description: A scruffy, apparently drunk man with his arm in a sling slumped on the stairs in the IND subway station at Jay StreetBoro Hall in Brooklyn yesterday, a sheaf of dollar bills peeking from a torn pocket.

title: Harris Poll Shows 43% Want Conservative Trend
description: Louis Harris, the pollster, says a new survey shows more Americans want the country to move in a conservative rather than a liberal direction, hut fewer call themselves conservatives than in the past, according to The Associated Press.

title: For the Deep South, a New Day of Politics
description: VICKSBURG, Miss.  When a complainant brought up the issue of morality during a discussion of alleged racial discrimination in employment at the Waterways Experiment Station here, Charles Evers, the Mayor of nearby Fayette, interrupted him. We all got to remember, Mr.

title: College and School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: It's News to NBC: N Is for Nebraska
description: A clash of corporate imagery has given the National Broadcasting Company, which went about it in a big New York way, virtually the same symbol that the Nebraska Educational Television Network came up with through its own art department working regular hours.

title: Fire in Pentagon Cafeteria
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 6 (AP)  A fire that destroyed a cafeteria in the Pentagon caused about S400,00 damage. officials said today. The estimate was made as investigators attempted to learn the cause of the blaze, which burned for an hour yesterday, only 50 feet away from the building's military, nerve center.

title: BRISK GAINS MADE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market registered strong gains yesterday in more active trading.

title: Turkey and U.S. Resume Defense Pact Negotiations
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan. 6 (AP)Turkey and the United States have resumed negotiations toward a revised defense pact after several weeks of Christmas recess, officials said today.

title: Jackson Starts Swing in State; Makes Contact With 3 Big Blocs
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson made contact with three of the major bases of the New York Democratic Party yesterday as he spoke to labor, Jewish and IrishAmerican groups in the first of 30 scheduled appearances in this state in the three months prior to the April 6 Presidential primary.

title: Talks on Rheingold Held
description: Representatives of the Rheingold Brewing Company and its 1,100 workers here met yesterday in the office of City Council President Paul O'Dwyer for talks aimed at keeping the company's Brooklyn plant from closing down because of persisting deficits. Mr. O'Dwyer reported later that no progress was made, but that another meeting would take place this morning.

title: Soetaert Loses in First Start in Goal, 52
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 7 The St. Louis Blues ruined Doug Soetaert's debut as a starting goalie in the National Hockey League tonight as they defeated the Rangers, 52.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: The crescendo of buying in the days before Christmas is inevitably followed during the days after by the decrescendo of returning. The sweaters that do not fit, the ties that bring forced smiles and concealed moans, the musk oil perfume that evokes a vision of a damp basement all make the trip back to the store.

title: FORD AT FUNERAL FOR C.I.A. OFFICER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 President Ford led 500 mournners in a brief funeral service today for Richard S. Welch, the Central Intelligence Agency officer who was assassinated two days before Christmas in Greece.

title: Credenza
description: Remember when you thought it was something to play? Learn something new and interesting from the

title: The Dance: Hamlet From Neumeier
description: The world premiere of John Neumeier's ballet Hamlet Connotations at the Uris Theater last night was not so much unhappy as unfortunate. Good intentions were emblazoned all over it. This major production by American Ballet Theater had an international cast of dancers  Mikhail Baryshnikov, Gelsey Kirkland, Marcia Haydee, Erik Bruhn and William Carterthat few, if any, companies in the world could equal. But the dancers were frittering away their time with a kind of unselfconscious desperation. There should have been an easier, a more rewarding way.

title: Soviet Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (UPI)  The Soviet Union launched today an earth satellite, Cosmos 787, to continue exploration of outer space, Tass, the Soviet press agency, reported.

title: Stock Prices Soar
description: Stock prices soared yesterday for the second consecutive session in one of the heaviest trading days in history. The Dow Jones industrials climbed 12.99 points to 890.82 on a volume of 31.27 million shares. Page 55.

title: TV: History Nicely Told in Suddenly an Eagle
description: On the electronic face of it, Suddenly an Eagle is something of a showandtell lecture, falling somewhere between dramatization and documentary. All of which probably doesn't sound very intriguing, except that the subject is American history, which is bound to be a popular Bicentennial commodity and which has always presented format problems to TV pro ducers. Documentaries using paintings, drawings and appropriate graphics tend to go lifeless: dramatization's can be tricky, if not embarrassing (does anyone remember Eric Sevareid of CBS News interviewing a Peter Ustinov done up in George III costume?).

title: Bomb Plotter Sentenced
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. I(UPI) A Federal judge has sentenced the last person tried in the plot to blow up Kanawha County schools during textbok protests. David Green, who pleaded guilty in November to his role in the 1974 conspiracy to bomb the West Branch Elementary School in Cabin Creek, was sentenced yesterday to a year and a day in prison.

title: JobTraining Provider Gets Probation in Billing Fraud
description: Murray J. King, of Woodcliff Lake, N.J., president of the Vidata Corporation, who last month pleaded guilty to overcharging to Federal agency for his company's services in providing job training for disadvantaged workers, was sentenced here yesterday to three years probation.

title: Recital: Ivanich at Piano
description: When Miklos Ivanich appeared at Town Hall in 1969, he was criticized for an artistic insensitivity that failed to Enliven a big, proficient technique. Monday night, at Alice Tully Hall, the artistry was in greater evidence, hut his technique betrayed it.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS SAY ANGOLAN LEFTISTS WON KEY VICTORY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Highranking American officials said today that the leftist Luandabased faction in Angola had achieved a significant victory on the northern front over the weekend, but was still on the defensive elsewhere.

title: Two Who Found a Wallet Give Reward to Neediest
description: On a visit to the city from New Jersey, a teaching brother in a Roman Cathoic high school and a student found a wallet in shrubbery near Central Park. With the help of the telephone company, they traced the owner to his home in Brooklyn and mailed the billfold containing valuable contents to him.

title: RENVILLE M'MANN, A TENNIS OFFICIAL
description: Renville H. McMann, tor many years a leading administrative figure in tennis who influenced major changes in the game, died yesterday in the Homestead Nursing Horne in Stamford, Conn. He was 80 years old and lived at 60 East 96th Street.

title: 4 in Watergate Appeal Say Sirica Barred a Fair Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Lawyers for the four former Nixon Administration officials convicted last year in the Watergate coverup case told the United States Court of Appeals here today that Federal District Judge John J. Sirica had failed in numerous ways to give the defendants a fair trial.

title: Recanter in Carter Case Says Defense Bribed Him
description: Alfred Bello, a major prosecution witmss in the trinlemurder convictions of Rubin (Hurricane) CiIrter and John Artis, said in an affidavit filed yesterday that he had been offered a bribe by a defense investigator if he would recant his testimony.

title: C. I. A. IS REPORTED TO GIVE ANTIREDS IN ITALY $6 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  The Central Intelligence Agency has funneled at least S6 million in secret cash payments to individual antiCommunist political leaders in Italy since Dec. 8 in an effort to prevent further Communist Party gains in national elections there, wellinformed sources said today.

title: Spelling Out the Public Identity of the Handicapped
Nadjari Calls Cunningham A Salesman of Judgeships
description: Maurice H. Nadjari, the special state prosecutor, charged yesterday that Patrick J. Cunningham, the Democratic state chairman, was at the center of the corrupt marketplace of judgeships in the Bronx and specifically accused him of selling judgeships, accepting bribes and fixing at least one criminal case.

title: Books of The Times
description: ANATOMY AND DESTINY. By Stephen Kern. 307 pages. Illustrated. BobbsMerrill. $10.95.

title: Farmers Assail Seabrook Curtailment
description: BRIDGETON, Jan. 6Seabrook Farms, the state's largest food processor, was berated by farmers at an emotional public meeting here today for not giving its vegetable suppliers advance notice of plans to stop processing fresh produce in New Jersey.

title: COUNCIL UNIT VOTES A SPLIT PARK AGENCY
description: Legislation splitting the Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs Administration into two separate departments was voted out yesterday by the City Council Committee on Charter and Governmental Operations. The full Council is expected to pass the legislation in two weeks.

title: City Seizes Merchandise Displayed on Sidewalk
description: If we can't solve the small problems, how can we solve the big ones? asked Sidney Baumgarten, assistant to the Mayor, his nose turning red from standing in the cold.

title: As Lefkowitz Strolls City, Everyone Calls Him Louie
description: On Park Avenue at 52d Street early yesterday morning, Louis J. Lefkowitz, walking south, met Ray Brown, walking north.

title: Prison Guards 1Day Job Action Wins Them Some Pay Concession
description: TRENTON, Jan. 6A oneday job action yesterday by state prison guards got them an immediate wage increase of about one hour's pay a week.

title: Britain Adds Ulster Force After Killings
description: LONDON, Jan. 6The British Government announced today that it was sending more than 600 reinforcements to South Armagh, scene of the slaying of 10 Protestants last night.

title: Rhodesian Regime Opens Talks With Black Nationalist Leaders
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Jan. 6 (Reuters)Black and white negotiators met for 90 minutes today at the start of what is expected to he long, hard bargaining over Rhodesia's future.

title: It's News to NBC: N Is for Nebraska
description: A clash of corporate imagery has given the National Broadcasting Company, which went about it in a big New York way, virtually the same symbol that the Nebraska Educational Television Network came up with through its own art department working regular hours.

title: No Service
description: Patrick J. Cunningham, the state Democratic chairman, has a right to use any legal stratagem at his command to evade testimony before a grand jury investigating the alleged sale of judgeships in his home borough of the Bronx. But he does Governor Carey (and himself) a disservice when he challenges a subpoena from Special Prosecutor Nadjari largely on the basis that Mr. Carey had revoked Mr. Nadjari's authority by firing him.

title: Shortage of Snow in Soviet Threatening Winter Grains
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (AP) A snow shortage threatens the Soviet Union with new crop troubles on top of its worst grain harvest in a decade last year.

title: Haifa's Mayor Named Chairman Of the World Zionist Executive
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 6Mayor Yosef Almogi of Haifa was elected chairman of the World Zionist Executive tonight.

title: Israeli Official on a Tough Mission
description: JERUSALEM. Jan. 6On the eve of Yigal Allon's departure for Washington earlier this week, a political cartoon in Haaretz the Hebrew language daily, succinctly summed up the current political predictment of Israel's Deputy Prime Minister, who is also Foreign Minister. In the cartoon, drawn by Ze'ev. the Israeli Herblock. Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin is shown helping Mr. Allon with his coat before he boards the plane for the United States. They are both smiling politely. but Mr. Rabin has knotted the sleeves of his deputy's jacket, binding his arms firmly behind him.

title: Whites and Indians Found to Be Alike In Alcohol Response
description: BOSTON, Jan. 6 (UPI)  Available biological evidenee does not support the notion that American Indians.. respond to alcohol differently.from whites, according to an article in The New England Journal of Medicine.

title: About Education
description: The basic assumptions underlying one of the celebrated educational causes of the day  "career education  have come under fire in the current issue of the Harvard Educational Review.

title: Notes on People
description: Robert Anderson, the main press spokesman for the State Department, made news himself yesterday as President Ford nominated him to be Ambassador to Morocco. Mr. Anderson, a career diplomat, has been special assistant for press relations to Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger since 1974. Before that he served as Ambassador to Danomey, now Known as Benin, and in other posts in Europe and the Far East.

title: She Demonstrates How to Cook Best With New Cuisinart
description: TIBURON, Calif. If we were to name the greatest food news event of the last yearindeed, the last couple of decadesit would undoubtedly be the phenomenal nationwide acceptance of the Cuisinart, the Frenchmade food processor. It has been heralded from Boot Head, Me., to Eureka, Calif., as perhaps the greatest food invention since toothpicks. It is predictable that the current year will see the advent of books on how to use the food processor, and we recently had the pleasure of meeting the first person who, to our knowledge, is offering cooking classes tailored to the machine's use.

title: New Jobs in Private Sector to Be Carey Priority
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Governor Carey, in his annual message to the Legislature tomorrow, will set the creation of jobs in the private sector as his top priority for the coming year, and will plead with businessmen to remain in the state while it works out its fiscal problems, according to aides familiar with the speech.

title: Article 2  No Title
Moscow Denies Paying $50 Million Bribe on Angola
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (AP) The Soviet Union today denied that it had paid a $50 million bribe to a West African leader for his support of the Luandabased faction in Angola.

title: About Real Estate
description: For several years now, thereal estate world has been speculating on the nature and potential of foreign investments here. The speculation grew most intense when the sudden worldwide increase in oil prices created new investment wealth in the Middle East.

title: MOSCOW REBUTS FORD ON ANGOLA
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6The Soviet Government newspaper Izvestia issued a toughly worded rejection today of the recent attacks on its Angola involvement by President Ford and Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger.

title: British Fire Kills 5
description: BRIGHTON. England, Jan. (AP)  Four persons were killed early today and five others were believed dead in a fire that swept through the fivestory Royal Hotel on the seafront of this South Coast resort, the poiice reported. The cause of the fire was not known.

title: As Lefkowitz Strolls City, Everyone Calls Him Louie
description: On Park Avenue at 52d Street early yesterday morning, Louis I Lefkowitz, walking south, met Ray Brown, walking north.

title: $225 Niagara Falls Meal Gets 0 Stars From Critic
description: It was not what it cost but what the City Councilmen of Niagara Falls. N.Y.. ate that bothered Angelo Sarkees, a local food faddist.

title: Eat Well And Save
description: THE BUDGET GOURMET, By Sylvia Vaughn Thompson, 302 pages, Random House, paperback., $5.95.

title: Friend of Lynette Fromme Has Bail Cut to $20.000
Judge Orders Halt to Crowding in Rikers
description: A Federal judge ordered the city yesterday to end within 10 days the practice of confining two inmates in oneman cells for more than 30 days at the overcrowded House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island.

title: Mrs. Peron, Seemingly Ill Again, Fails to Maintain Her Schedule
description: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 6 President Isabel Martinez de Pern, apparently ill again, failed to appear today for a publicized distribution of gifts to poor children and canceled a national television speech tomorrow.

title: Article 6  No Title
Bridge:
description: In the unlikely event that the Supreme Court ever has to decide a case involving bridge, the newest justice will be the resident expert. Justice John Paul Stevens, whose appointment was confirmed last month, has played the game for about 50 years and has more than 200 master. points. He and his wife play in local duplicate games once or twice a month, and in sectional and regional championships whenever his work permits.

title: JobTraining Provider Gets Probation in Billing Fraud
description: Murray J. King, of Woodeliff Lake N.J., president of the 1Valata Corporation. who last wont Ii pleaded guilty to overcharging to Federal agency for his company's services in providing job training for disad vantaged workers, was sentenced here yesterday to three Years probation.

title: Yachtsman Turner Purchases Braves
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 6 (AP)Ted Turner, a millionaire communications executive and internationally known yachtsman, bought the Atlanta Braves today.

title: Versatile Food Processor: What Can It Make? (Cont'd)
description: TABBOULEH

title: Dismissed Chief Retains Post as Vice President
WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Wheat futures drifted lower on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, reflecting some disappointment about exports. The May delivery closed at $3.53 a bushel, down from $3.58

title: Protest FailstoCutCoast Medical Care
New Face on Spanish Coins
description: MADRID, Jan. 6 (Reuters)For the first time in 40 years Spaniards will have a new face on their coinsthat of King Juan Carlos 1 in place of Franco.

title: MALPRACTICE PLAN IS URGED ON CAREY
Article 7  No Title
Rangers Drop Francis
description: The New York Rangers dismissed Emile Francis as general manager yesterday and were expected to name John Ferguson, a former Montreal Canadien, to the position. Details, Page 21.

title: JUDGE IS REMOVED OVER DUMPING BAN
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 6  Citing; gross bias and deliberate denial of due process, the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit ordered today that the Reserve Mining Company case be taken from the jurisdiction of Judge Miles Lord of the Federal District Court in Minneapolis and that the remaining issues be assigned to a new judge.

title: JUDGE IS REMOVED OVER DUMPING BAN
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 6  Citing gross bias and deliberate denial of due process. the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit ordered today that the Reserve Mining Company case be taken from the jurisdiction of Judge Miles Lord of the Federal District Court in Minneapolis and that the remaining issues be assigned to a new judge.

title: Federal Judge Orders an End To Crowding on Rikers Island
description: A Federal judge ordered the city yesterday to end within 10 days the practice of cinfihing two inmates in oneman cells for more than 30 days at the overcrowded House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island.

title: Judicial Editors
description: A definitive expression by the United States Supreme Court is clearly needed on the growing problem of courtordered prior restraint, i.e. censorship, of American newspapers. A new outbreak of judicial editing of the news through gag orders is causing total confusion for both bench and press, as well as abridging the right to publish under the First Amendment.

title: Albert Rudick Dies; Top Official Here For Liberian Ships
description: Albert J. Rudick, Liberia's Deputy Commissioner for Maritime Affairs, died Monday in his office at 103 Park Avenue. He was 57 years old and lived in Scarsdale, N. Y.

title: REAGAN IS LEADING FORD IN DONATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP)  Ronald Reagan is outpacingl President Ford in campaign fund raising.

title: School Ferry Plan Fought On Two Islands Off Maine
description: PORTLAND. Me.. Jan. 6 (AP)  Residents of two islands off Maine's coast say the hours their children might have to spend in boats going to elementary school would be worse than mandatory busing.

title: Turner Used to Victory at Sea, But Braves Pose a Stern Test
description: The news that Ted Turner, the dashing millionaire yachtsman, had purchased the Atlanta Braves baseball team yesterday must have shocked his many admirers.

title: Going out Guide
description: PRESENT INDICATIVE The casually dressed young people crowding the tiownlown Lady Astor's (2287888) last weekend probably weren't thinking of archilectural history. The reason was Gerri Griffin, a popsoul singer, who is continuing tomorrow through Saturday.

title: Tenants Cope With the Misery of Unheated Buildings
description: A retired merchant seaman M. C. Wright. huddled yesterday under blankets with his two young grandchildren close to a lighted gas stove because: the heat in his building has not worked for several days.

title: WINE TALK
description: It is time once again to take a look at what everyone is drinking these dayswhat and how much.

title: C.I.A. Funding in Europe Said to Go Back 3 Decades
description: Support by the United States Central Intelligence Agency for Christian Democrats and Socialists to retain power in Italy, West Germany and France after World War II has long been informally rumored.

title: OTTO W. EISELE, 73, AMATEUR BICYCLIST
description: Otto W. Eisele, an amateur bicyclist and retired railroad official, died Monday at the White Plains Center for Nursing Care. He was 73 years old and lived in White Plains.

title: State G.O.P. Elects 37 to Be Delegates At 76 Convention
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6  With only a ripple of dissent, leaders of the State Republican Committee today elected 37 delegates to the Republican National Convention, an uncommitted slate that will be led by Vice President Rockefeller.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: TRANSFERS LISTED BY EQUITY FUNDING
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6 Officials of the Equity Funding Life Insurance Company stated here today that 18,300 of the concern's policies had been Insurance Company of Seattle, Insuranec Compnay of Seattle, that the policyholders had emerged without any liens on the policies, and that the company had settled claims with defrauded coinsurers.

title: U.S. Welfare Rolls Show Second Consecutive Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP)  The nation's welfare rolls increased by twotenths of 1 percent last September, the second consecutive monthly increase, the Government announced today.

title: Turning Point in Angolan Strife Is Seen
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 6Western intelligence sources here say that the apparent capture of Uige, headquarters of the National Front for the Liberation of Angola, could prove to be a military turning point in the Angolan civil war.

title: Guidebook Tells the Father What He Ought to Know to Share His Wife's Pregnancy
description: LONDON  Some men break out with hives. Some lose sleep. Some don't want to think about it all Some even have stomach cramps.

title: CAREY OFFICE SCENE OF COOP CITY SITIN
description: About 100 residents of Coop City in the Bronx occupied the offices of Governor Carey here for six hours yesterday to demand a meeting with him on the problem of increases in their monthly carrying charees.

title: NEWS GUILD TOLD TO PUT OFF TRIALS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 A Federal judge ordered today a postponement until at least Jan. 15 of union disciplinary trials for more than 300 members of the Newspaper Guild at The Washington Post who have crossed picket lines at the newspaper and continued to work during a bitter 13week pressmen's strike.

title: Ford's Best Ally: Reagan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 The political exhibition season has started in the bitter cold of New Hampshire, and this may be the best thing that has happened to Gerald Ford since he fell into the Presidency.

title: F.B.I. Said to Drop Plan to Seek Body Of Hoffa in Jersey
description: DETROIT. Jan. 6 (UPI)  Federal sources said today that the F.B.I. was abandoning its plan to search in a New Jersey dump for the body of James R. Hoffa, the former teamsters union chief. One source said the F.B.I. no longer suspected his body was buried there.

title: About New York
description: The big issues now agitating the people who will bring you the Democratic National Convention in July are these: How, exactly, will the delegates get from Madison Square Garden to their hotels? Will the Congressmen be allowed to sit on the Garden floor and have speaking priviliges, too? And, what about the reporters?

title: Stock Prices Climb 12.99 to 890.82 on Dow As Trading Soars to 31.27 Million Shares
description: Stock prices soared yesterday for the second consecutive session in one of the heaviest trading days in history.

title: Leftists in Portugal Open AntiGovernment Drive
description: LISBON, Jan. 6After a month of relative calm, leftist organizations have launched what appears to be a broad offensive against the Government, attacking simultaneously new austerity measures, press controls and alleged abuses of human rights.

title: Pimientos Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration today recalled 39,000 cans of pimientos because of defects in the canning process that it said pose a potential for bacterial growth. The brand involved is Goya Fancy Pimientos, with the foreign registry number 14.301 on the label. They were manufactured by Carreno Cuardrado Hermanos, S.A., Cehegin, Murcia, Spain, and recalled by Goya Foods Inc., Syracuse.

title: Colorado Seeks a New Law on Obscenity
description: DENVER, Jan. 7The Colorado Legislature began today its 1976 centennial session faced with the task of enacting a new antiobscenity law. The State Supreme Court struck down Monday all existing state laws and a Denver law on the ground that they were vague and unconstitutional.

title: C.I.A. DISCOUNTS CHINA'S OIL ROLE
description: A United States Government study, triggered by China's sudden emergence as a major oil producer, predicts that Peking is unlikely to become a significant force in world petroleum markets despite rapid current Increases in output.

title: ExTrapeze Artist Lands Dog Act at Soviet Circus
description: Although she couldn't understand the announcer, Polina Chernega was applauding as vigorously as any other ringsider at the American spaniel Club's Specialty in the Stetler Hilton, as the dogs were gaited round the ring last Sunday.

title: Atlantic City Aides Are Ruled Overpaid
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7  Judge Herbert Horn of Atlantic County Superior Court ruled today that the five Atlantic City Commissioners have been overpaid nearly $300,000 since 1971 because of a state law tying municipal salaries to population size.

title: Study Upgrades Value of Tidal Marshes
description: What is the value of an acre of coastal mud, covered with patches of tall grass, often populated by coots and rodents, and flooded at regular intervals?

title: Text of Governor's State of the State Message as Delivered to the Legislature
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Following is the text of Governor Carey's State of the State message as delivered to the Legislature. A longer written version was given to the Legislature and the press.

title: American Banker Shifts Top Management
description: A sweeping upheaval in the management of The American Banker, a respected, 139year old trade paper, read daily by about 16,000 bankers climaxed yesterday in the election of a new president. The publication has been rocked by charges of excessive travel and entertainment expense's and mismanagement and by counter charges of nepotism.

title: Court Finds Atlantic City Aides To Be Overpaid by $300,000
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7  Judge Herbert Horn of Atlantic County Superior Court ruled today that the five Atlantic City Commissioners have been overpaid nearly $300,000 since 1971 because of a state law tying municipal salaries to population size.

title: Text of Ford Letter to Nigeria's Leader on U.S. Attitude on Angola
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 7 (Reuters)  Following, as made public today by the Nigerian Government. is the text of a letter on the Angolan situation from President Ford to Brig. Murtala Muhammed, the Nigerian chief of state.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
After Year's Tour, Homer Dies Quickly on Broadway
description: How could Home Sweet Homer, a Broadway musical, close in New York after one performance when it played to good crowds during a yearlone crosscountry tour?

title: 4 FAMILY FARMS WILL BE HONORED
description: ALBANY  The continuing importance of the family farm in the economy of the state will be emphasized this week in Syracuse when four dairy farms that have remained in the same family for more than 100 years receive awards from the New York State Agricultural Society.

title: City Union Observer Admitted By State Fiscal Control Board
description: Jack Bigel, the labor consultant, has been installed as the city municipal unions regular observer at the meetings of the State Emergency Financial Control Board. The assignment is in lieu, of the fullfledged post for labor that Governor Carey once, favored but now has dropped.

title: CABINET IN ITALY IS FORCED TO QUIT AS SUPPORT ENDS
description: ROME, Jan. 7The Italian Cabinet resigned tonight, generating political tensions that could lead to national elections this year.

title: Abstract Films by Hollis Frampton Shown at Whitney
description: The projector hums steadily. You notice it. You notice the red Exit and No Smoking signs. You notice the creaking of the elevator in some nearby cavern. You notice the dust in the beam of light traveling from the projection booth. You notice your own hair, your shirt collar, your fingernails, your unanswered letters. And after some 15 minutes of the Whitney Museum's latest experimental film program, about all you can do with what's on the screen is notice it, in precisely the same way.

title: Francis Refused to Quit; Insisted on Full Control
description: Characteristically, Emile Francis refused the Rangers offer to allow him to resign. Instead, he insisted that the wording of his announcement show that he was dismissed as general manager of the Rangers.

title: JERSEY TO EXPAND BOND INFORMATION
description: New standards of information for investors, resulting from New York City's financial crisis, were set yesterday as New Jersey bowed to demands of hankers for more data in the sale of a $50 million bond issue.

title: Cheerful Crusader
description: As editor of The Nation, and later its owner, Freda Kirchwey had a greater influence on her times than she would ever have conceded. Her modest and tolerant way of working and living never permitted devotion to principle to spill over into the kind of personal ambition or driving selfrighteousness that so often marks the reformer.

title: Women Golfers Get Masters Event
description: A $70,000 women's golf tournament modeled after the men's Masters at Augusta, Ga., was announced here yesterday. The Ladies Masters, a 72hole invitation event to be played May 6 to 9, will be open to the top 40 moneywinners on the tour and to other designated pros and amateurs from the United States and abroad. The site will be the Devil's Elbow course of Moss Creek Plantation, the sponsor, on Calibague Sound in South Carolina, opposite Hilton Head Island.

title: Argentines Learn to Live, Unhappily, With Inflation of 335%
description: BUENOS AIRES Jan. 7At the Budapest Bar near the docks, where seamen and longshoremen drink cheap wine and smoke black tobacco, an oldtimer riffled a sheaf of crisp Argentine 10peso notes, fresh from the mint.

title: .435 College Hitter First Pick in Draft
description: The Detroit Tigers selected a .435 hitter from the University of Southern California, Steve Kemp, in the first pick yesterday in major league baseball's 11th annual winter draft of amateur players.

title: TWO OIL COMPANIES FINED IN PRICE FIXING
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7 (AP)Two oil companies have been fined $50,000 each for illegally fixing the price of gasoline in five Western states.

title: OneYear Bills Sold By the U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 The Treasury auctioned oneyear bills today at an average yield of 5.578 percent.

title: Article 6  No Title
U.S. to Oppose Changing Basis of Mideast Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that the United States would strongly oppose any moves in the United Nations Security Council to change the resolutions that have for many years provided the basis for Middle East negotiations.

title: Quick British Approval Of Mrs. Armstrong Seen
description: LONDON, Jan. 7 (AP)  The British Government intends to give swift approval to the appointment of Anne L. Armstrong as the United States ambassador.

title: Byrne Tries Again For Income Tax Law
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7Governor Byrne began a final effort today to have a state income tax approved by the current Legislature when it convenes tomorrow for its last session.

title: Jackson on Cuba
description: MIAMI, Jan. 7 (Reuters)Senator Henry M. Jackson urged today that the United States reconsider the decision last August to lift the ban against overseas subsidiaries of American companies trading with Cuba.

title: Market Place
description: The position of the nation's real estate investment trust industry can be described as shaky at best. Yet there may be speculative profits in selected trust debt securities.

title: Ashe, Okker Triumph in W.C.T. Play
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 7 (AP)Arthur Ashe and Tom Okker posted victories tonight in the $64,000 Columbus tennis tournament, which opened the World Championship Tennis winter circuit.

title: Testimony by Dr. X in 1966 About Curare A Key Factor of New Inquiry Into Deaths
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Jan. 7 Between Sept. 21, 1965, and Sept. 28, 1966, Dr. X bought 24 vials of purified curare from a surgical supply company in northern New Jersey, according to records in the original investigation into the unusual or unexplained deaths at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell.

title: U.S. SENATORS MEET AUSTRALIAN LEADERS
description: CANBERRA. Australia, Jan. 7 Four United States Senators today had wideranging talks with Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser and Foreign Minister Andrew Peacock in the first official contacts between the United States and Australia at a senior level since the Liberal and Country parties won a resounding election victory over the Labor Party last month.

title: Notes on People
description: Richard M. Nixon has joined a conservatively oriented political club in Orange County, Calif., it was disclosed yesterday, but a club spokesman said that did not mean that the former President planned soon to reenter public life.

title: Soviet Wings Win by 42, But Hawks Make It Rough
Effect of Flights on Ozone Is Minimized
description: GENEVA, Jan. 7The World Meteorological Organization predicted today that the number of supersonic transport planes now planned would not have a significant effect on the ozone in the stratosphere or an effect that could be distinguished from natural variations.

title: Dance: Welcome Team
description: There was a timetoward the end of the last centurywhen the Italians dominated the whole world of ballet. The time passed, although the technical legacy  chiefly through the teaching methods of Enrico Cecchetti remains. In recent years there has been something of a ballet resurgence in Italy, although there is still lacking a major Italian company. There are now, however, a handful of major Italian dancers, and the two most distinguished, Carla Fracci and Paolo Bortoluzzi, returned to American Ballet Theater at the Uris Theater last night after an absence of nearly two years.

title: CAR SALES ROSE 31% IN DEC, 2130
MONNINGTON DEAD; BRITISH MURALIST, 73
description: TUNBRIDGE WELLS, England, Jan. 7 (AP)Sir Thomas Monnington, president of the Royal Academy, the organization of top British artists and architects, died today at his home here. He was 73 years old.

title: CANADIAN DIARIES RECALL SPY CASE
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 7Former Prime Minister William Lyon Mackenzie King feared that the revelation in 1945 of Soviet esponiage operations would result in a movement in western Canada to on the United States for protection, according to his diaries made public today.

title: Stage: Vignettes in Mime
description: Mime is the art of metaamorphosis, says Marcel Marceau. It is the art of ellipse. the extreme art of the moment. I reject the anecdote to become the feeling. Watching Mr. Marceau perform this difficult theatrical art, the audience has to see the invisible.

title: Law Giving Nixon's Tapes To U.S. is Upheld by Court
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7A threejudge Federal court unanimously upheld today the 1974 law that gave the Government control over Richard M. Nixon's Presidential papers and tape recordings, saying that Congress had had an adequate basis for concluding that Mr. Nixon might not be a wholly reliable custodian of the materials.

title: People in Sports
description: Dick Battista, the bowler who became the first athlete to receive a heart transplant, plans to return to competition Sunday in the $100.000 Showboat invitation tournament in Las Vegas, Nev. The 44yearold former Roller Derby perrormer received a new heart in a 10hour operation Oct. 9 at Stanford University Medical Center. He has been rolling 15 practice games daily, and doctors are optimistic about him.

title: Wilmington Braces for an Almost Certain Battle Over Busing
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Jan. 6When Edith Seiffert ran into Jane Berger at a suburban supermarket here today, she asked about the agenda for their ParentTeachers Association meeting next week.

title: FORD LABOR AIDES CONSIDER RESIGNING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP)The 10 labor members of President Ford's collective bargaining committee in construction are considering resigning to protest his veto of the common site picketing bill, it was learned tonight.

title: GOVERNOR OPENS 76 LEGISLATURE ON AUSTERE NOTE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7With a grim declaration that we have no future if our budget is not truly in balance, Governor Carey today offered the Legislature a program of more spending cuts, possible further increases in taxes and reduced government services.

title: Angolan War: Test for AmericanSoviet Detente
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7The Soviet Union's involvement in Angola seems at least partly based on a belief that the ghost of Vietnam still haunts American diplomacy, narrowing American options, reducing American flexibility and undermining Washington's leverage against Moscow. Soviet analysts understand the debilitating effects of the United States involvement in Vietnam. They are keenly aware of the resulting aversion in Congress and among the American public to any substantive role in another civil war.

title: 2 Black Neurosurgeons Defend BehaviorAltering Operations
description: RESTON, Va., Jan. 7Two Mack neurosurgeons said today that although the controversial behavioraltering brain surgery called psychosurgery should not be banned, its continued practice., should be placed under, strict government controls.

title: Coop City Lawyers Press To Collect Tenant Fines
description: Lawyers for the huge Coop City apartment complex in the Bronx, where most of the 15,000 families have been resisting a 25 percent increase in carrying charges, have begun steps to collect courtimposed fines levied against leaders of he resistance.

title: Bridge:
description: A player who doubles an opponent in a game that has been bid voluntarily, expecting to succeed, is usually either a beginner or an expert. The beginner doubles because he has a lot of high cards, and generally finds that for such a purpose honor strength, like patriotism, is not enough.

title: The 3Cent Parkman
description: Don't blame Francis Parkman for long lines at the Postal Service windows these days as people queue up for threecent stamps to put on their envelopes next to last year's tencenters. When he was around, the mail was delivered by pony expressas swiftly as some of the modern couriers make their uncertain appointed rounds. Francis Parkman  the face on 1.4 billion threecent stampswas an American historian who helped to change the style of historical writing in the middle or the last century. No Computer readouts for him or delving in the dissertations of others; to research The Oregon Trail, he lived with a band Sioux and observed frontier life personally. He wrote a narrative style that remains readable, one reason why the Society of American Historians, which stresses both good scholarship and fine literature, calls its prestigious annual award the Francis Parkman Prize. It's the kind history that is still hard to lick.

title: The Cast
description: in Mime for A Winter Night. Lighting and technical direction, Michell Bogard; setting by Carlos Delgado; costumes by Pamela Scofield; sound by Mitchell Green; masks by Fred Nihda; stage manager, David McGee. Presented by the Turtle Bay Company, Richard Morse and R. Edward Townley. At the Billy Munk Theater, 302 East 45th Street.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N.Y. 10242 or to these agencies:

title: PRICES INCREASED FOR SOME BEERS
description: Drinkers of major national beer brands will soon be paying more for their favorite brews. Three of the nation's major brewers  AnheuserBosch Inc., the Pabst Brewing Company and the Jos. Schlitz Brewing Companyannounced yesterday higher prices for their major brands. Local brewers had no comment. AnheuserBusch makes Budweiser and Michelob.

title: POOR LANDS AGREE ON I.M.F. DEMANDS
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Jan. 7Developing countries agreed today on a list of demands for more international financial help as finance ministers of 20 rich and poor countries met here to seek an accord on monetary issues.

title: Holidays Fine Skiing Conditions Continue
description: Ski resort operators throughout the North country were still enthusiastic yesterday over the huge turnouts during the recent holidays. Surface conditions that improved as the Christmas season progressed were chiefly responsible. Alan Fleischman, the head of Mount Snow at West Dover, Vt., said his resort had averaged 7,000 lift tickets for nine straight days. He said a crowd of about 8,000 last Friday was a new high for the 22yearold area.

title: Article 2  No Title
Reward Still Held Up In Yablonski Deaths
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Six years after $60,000 in rewards was pledged for the apprehension and conviction of the murderers of Joseph A. Yablonski the United Mine Workers reform challenger in a 1969 union election, criminal appeals are still holding up a decision on who may be entitled to the money.

title: Humphrey Delegates
description: CONCORD, N.H., Jan. 7 (AP) A full slate of delegates for Hubert H. Humphrey will be on the Feb. 24 New Hampshire primary ballot, the state coordinator for the former Vice President said today.

title: Albert Rice Leventhal Is Dead; A Book Publisher for 40 Years
description: Albert Rice Leventhal, an influential book publisher for more than 40 years, died in his sleep Tuesday night at his apartment, 12 East 63d Street. He was 68 years old.

title: BurnedOut Pupils Quickly Find New Home
description: BELLEVILLE, Jan, 7 When the telephone rang in the principal's office at Elementary School No. 7 here this afternoon, and Dorothy Loesner, the secretary. answered, School No. 3, it was not a mistake.

title: 10 Homeless in Fire
description: Ten families were left homeless by a threealarm fire in the Bushwick section of Brooklyn last night. The fire, of undetermined origin, burned through a row of five threestory apartment dwellings on Nimrod Street near Wilson Avenue, after breaking out in No. 160.

title: Protestants and Catholics Grieve Together in Ulster
description: BESSBROOK, Northern Ireland, Jan. 7The tiny front room of the house at 25 Thomas Street was filled with grieving people this morning.

title: Taxi Commission Rejects Fare Rise
description: The city's Taxi and Limousine Commission yesterday unanimously denied an application for a fare increase requested by the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The head of the Police Sergeants Benevolent Association asked Mayor Beame yesterday to restore free subway and bus privileges for offduty police officers as a way curb terrorism on the city's publictransit systems. Harold Melnick, president of the association, said most police officers had been driving to and from work since the city banned free rides for offduty police officers last year. The infinitesimal saving to the city is simply not worth in human terms, he said.

title: Reward Still Held Up In Yablonski Deaths
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Six years after $60.000 in rewards was pledged for the apprehension and conviction of the murderers of Joseph A. Yablonski, the United Mine Workers reform challenger in a 1969 union election, criminal appeals are still holding up a decision on who may be entitled to the money.

title: Italy, France, Japan  Where Will It All End?
description: STANFORD, Calif.The world's three largest nonruling Communist Parties, those of Italy, France and Japan, are proclaiming themselves independent of Moscow.

title: Plan Seeks to Reduce City's Utility Expenses
description: In an effort to trim the city's annual $110 million bill for heat, light and other energy supplies, the Municipal Service Administrator, John T. Carroll, proposed yesterday that each city agency be held financially accountable for its energy expenditures.

title: Inmates Find 2 a Crowd In Cells on Rikers Island
description: The cell is 6 feet wide, 8 feet long and 8 feet high. It was designed for one man.

title: Muskie Seeks Fourth Term
description: PORTLAND. Me., Jan. 7Senator Edmund S. Muskie, the 1968 Democratic VicePresidential nominee, announced over statewide television today his candidacy for a fourth term.

title: Green to Seek Scott's Seat
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7 (AP) United States Representative William J. Green, a Philadelphia Democrat, formally announced today that he will run next fall for the United States Senate seat of the retiring Republican leader, Hugh Scott.

title: ARTHUR WRIGHT, BRITISH SURGEON
description: LONDON, Jan. 7 (UPI)Arthur Dickson Wright, a surgeon who had the reputation of being able to perform any type of operation, died yesterday at St. Mary's Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: U.S. to Oppose Changing Basis of Mideast Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger said today that the United States would strongly oppose any moves in the United Nations Security Council to change the resolutions that have for many years provided the basis for Middle East negotiations.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Julie Wilson Sings In Different Styles At the Cafe Carlyle
description: In the eight years that Bobby Short has, been singing and playing the piano in the Cafe Carlyle, Madison Avenue at 76th Street, the room has acquired an aura that reflects his style and his repertory. Now that he is on his annual leave of absence, Julie Wilson, who is replacing him vocally (with William Roy in Mr. Short's place at the piano), is wisely capitalizing on that aura.

title: RutgersSt. John's Lures E.C.A.C. Final Into Garden
description: Madison Square Garden and the Eastern College Athletic Conference see dollar signs in contemplating a RutgersSt. John's final of the E.C.A.C. Metropolitan District basketball playoffs next month. As a result, the Garden, which didn't want to touch these E.C.A.C. playoffs a few weeks ago, is going to hold the Metropolitan District final on Saturday afternoon, March 6. The first round of the fourteam Metropolitan playoff will be held at Princeton on March 4. All this juggling has St. John's officials upset because, originally, the Metropolitan playoff was scheduled for St. John's Alumni Hall in Jamaica, Queens. That would have given St. John's the homecourt advantage.

title: Norway Agrees to Acquire Unit of British Petroleum
description: OSLO. Norway, Jan. 7 (Reuters)The Norwegian Parliament agreed today to the takeover of a subsidiary of the British Petroleum Company and of another gasoline company to create a statedominated company for refining and distributing petroleum products.

title: JAMAICA WORRIED BY SLUM FIGHTING
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, Jan. 7 Violence has flared in the slums of Kingston and some Jamaicans fear that if it intensifies it could result in civil war.

title: Fund for Neediest Cases Passes $700,000
description: The 64th annual appeal of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund passed the $700,000 mark yesterday with the receipt of $35,668.77 from 259 contributors. The overall figure now stands at $703,576.92.

title: Austrian Women Post Sweep in Cup Downhill
description: MEIRINGEN, Switzerland, Jan. 7 (AP)Brigitte Totschnigg led an Austrian sweep today of the first of two women's World Cup downhill ski races on the Planplatten Mountain.

title: New Car Sales Rose 31% in Dec. 2130, But 1975's Volume Hit a 13Year Low
description: DETROIT, Jan. 7  Sales of new American cars rose almost 31 percent in the last third of December and 34 percent for the full month, industry reports showed yesterday. The sales surge over the yearago periods capped a fourth quarter comeback, whch pulled the domestic automobile industry out of a twoyear slump.

title: Rangers Fill 2 Posts
description: The New York Rangers, who dropped Emile Francis as general manager Tuesday, dismissed Ron Stewart as coach yesterday and hired John Ferguson for both jobs. Details on Page 41.

title: 2 Sisters Thwart a Bank Robbery in Indiana Town
description: AMBOY, Ind., Jan. 7 (UPI)Two sisters foiled a bank robbery by disabling the holdup men's car and then chasing one of them down and handcuffing him with a belt.

title: BRITISH RABBI BACK FROM SOVIET VISIT
description: LONDON, Jan. 7Immanuel Jakobovits. Britain's Chief Rabbi, has returned from a visit to the Soviet Union with what he called perfect faith that Jews there will survive as Jews despite great discouragement.

title: Churchill Rodgers, 74. Dies; Metropolitan Life Counsel
Census Finds Adults Wed Later, Divorce Sooner
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) American adults are slower to marry and quicker to divorce than at any other time in history, according to the Census Bureau.

title: Clue in a Trouser Cuff Foils Kidnappers in Paris
description: PARIS, Jan. 7A recordcompany executive held for $3.5 million ransom for a week was freed tonight in the countryside southwest of Paris. Later, the police said they had arrested the leader of the kidnappers.

title: 3 ON COUNCIL SEEK NEW G.O.P. LEADER
description: Three Republican Councilmen were rebuffed yesterday when they asked the full Council to oust their minority leader, Angelo J. Arculeo of Brooklyn.

title: Veteran Held in Four Deaths
description: SPOKANE, Jan. 7 (UPI) A Vietnam war veteran was booked into the countycity jail today on four counts of firstdegree murder stemming from the shooting deaths of his mother, sister and two nephews. Larry Thompson, 27 years old, was arrested about two and a half hours after his father found the bodies at the family home yesterday. The victims were identified as Lavonne Thompson, 49; Sandra Kerns, 21; Justin Kerns, 5, and Jason Thompson, 4.

title: Appeal on Baggage Search Curb Is Aimed at Tightening Security
description: District Attorney Nicholas Ferraro of Queens sought yesterday to overturn a Criminal Court decision limiting the rights of law enforcement officials in airline and airport baggage searches.

title: Nadjari Jury Investigating 3 Bronx Civil Court Judges
description: A special grand ?? is ?? centering its investigation on how three Civil Court judges elected in 1975 obtained their Bronx judgeships, according to political and law enforcement sources.

title: 2 Soccer Stars Ask Asylum
description: BERNE. Jan. 7 (UPI)Two Hungarian soccer stars, Josef Horvath and Laszlo Harsanyi, have requested political asylum in Switzerland for themselves and their families, Swiss Government officials said today. The two men and their families came to Switzerland several weeks ago and are somewhere in the central part of the country, the officials said. They added the request for asylum was being studied.

title: Soviet Reports 20 Quakes
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7 (Reuters) More than 20 earthquakes were recorded today in the Pacific near the Kamchatka Peninsula in the most intensive burst of seismic activity in the area for nearly 25 years, the Soviet press agency Tass reported. The shocks had a force of 6 to 7 on a 12point scale, Tass added.

title: Sonics Thwart Knicks
FREDERICK H. BERGES JR
description: Frederick II, Berges Jr., a lawyer and former White Plains city judge. died Sunday at a nursing home in Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Basketball Ratings
description: WRITERS POLL

title: 2 Teachers Who Used Penalty Box Will Lose Jobs
description: BUTTE, Mont., Jan. 7 (AP)Two teachers who confined a retarded child in a small behavioral modification box will not he rehired and the school principal will he demoted, school officials say.

title: Opening the Rosenberg Files
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass.Contrary to the impression one might get from the press, our Freedom of Information Act request for the files on our parents, Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, has brought about the release of less than 30 percenta conservative estimateof the Federal Bureau of Investigation material. Every page has been released at the Government's discretion.

title: Hearing Held on Radio Ban on Contraceptive Devices
description: A top Department of Health, Education and Welfare official urged the National Council of Churches to oppose any campaign to liberalize the present National Association of Broadcasters ban on advertisements for nonprescription contraceptives.

title: Law Giving Nixon's Tapes To U.S. Is Upheld by Court
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7A threejudge Federal court unanimously upheld today the 1974 law that gave the Government control over Richard M. Nixon's Presidential papers and tape recordings, saying that Congress had had an adequate basis for concluding that Mr. Nixon might not be a wholly reliable custodian of the materials.

title: With a Fanfare, U.S. Salesmen Make Merry at Blenheim
description: WOODSTOCK, England Martin Davis, a salesman who lives in Queens, and his wife, Dale, who teaches fifth grade at a public school in the East Bronx, had dinner at Bleinheim Palace last weekend.

title: STATE DEBT LAW VOIDED BY COURT
description: A state law permiting debtors to be arrested for contempt of court and sent to jail for up to 90 days without a hearing was declared unconstitutional yesterday by a panel of three Federal judges here.

title: Carey's Vision of a New Age and New Realities
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7 Last year Governor Carey told the legislature that the days of wine and roses are over. Today, in a message whose grimness was reflected on the faces of his listeners, lie described the new age he sees as having replaced those now longgone days. We enter a new age, Mr. Carey said, in which our goals are less government, less spending, fewer government employees, less interference in the lives of our citizens and businessmen.

title: Fillmore Celebration Draws a Throng of 30
description: Millard Fillmore. 13th in the line of Presidents and last in the memory of his countrymen, drew a record commemorative throng to his grave in Buffalo yesterday30 people.

title: The Italian Crisis
description: An Italian Government in the midst of a major legislative effort to generate badly needed capital for investment and industrial reconstruction has been brought down because the Socialist Party saw shortrun political advantage in withdrawing its support in Parliament. This is shockingly irresponsible behavior and represents an abrupt aboutface in the Socialist attitude toward the Government of Prime Minister Aldo Moro.

title: Music: Perlman Mastery
description: Itzhak Perlman can hardly be considered a musical elder statesman, having only last year turned the corner into his 30's, but the Israeli violinist certainly played like one at Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night.

title: EUROPE'S 9 URGED TO WORK ON UNITY
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 7Prime Minister Leo Tindemans of Belgium, in a sober report on the future of Europe, has called on the Common Market to lay a basis for a European union by quickly improving its coordination of economic and foreign policy.

title: Syracuse Survives Rally, Beats Fordham, 55 to 48
description: SYRACUSE. N.Y.. Jan. 7Syracuse stopped a late Fordham rally and scored a 5548 victory tonight.

title: A LEITER BY FORD ANGERS NIGERIANS
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 7 (Reuters)Governmentowned Nigerian newspapers today accused President Ford of having insulted the intelligence of African nations with a letter urging them to help bring about a quick negotiated end to the Angolan civil war and a government of all factions there.

title: Mortgagee Begins Foreclosure Action Over McAlpin Hotel
description: Foreclosure proceedings have been initiated against the McAlpin Hotel, which is operated by a company that is part of the extensive realestate holdings of Sol Goldman and the late Alexander Di Lorenzo Jr.

title: CHRYSLER WILL PAY BRITAIN 12% RATE
description: DETROIT, Jan. 7 (Reuters)The Chrysler Corporation said today that under the British Government's financing agreement to rescue Its British subsidiary, the company would pay interest roughly equivalent to 12 percent until 1980 on the Government's longterm loans totaling $118.8 million over the next four years.

title: Court Voids a School Seniority Policy
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn has overturned the Board of Education's policy on seniority layoffs, holding that seniority should be based on a teacher's total length of service at his school level and not in his area of specialty or license.

title: Pillsbury Signs New Pact To Acquire Steak and Ale
description: The Pillsbury Company, a major food processor and one of the largest flour millers in the United States, said yesterday that it had signed a new agreement for the merger of Steak and Ale Restaurants of America Inc. into Pillsbury. Terms of the agreement, slightly changed from one announced on Oct. 7, 1975, provide that the holders of Steak and Ale's 4.23 million common shares will receive 0.6 of a share of Pillsbury common for each of their shares. The exchange ratio originally was 0.636 share for each Steak and Ale share.

title: VOTERS CAUTIOUS ON REAGAN STANDS
description: PLYMOUTH, N.H., Jan. 7Ronald Reagan may be leading President Ford in the Gallup Poll's national standings, but in his first campaign tour in this state he ran into problems with the canny, cautious New Hampshire voters.

title: State's Population Nears 7.5 Million, But Growth Slows
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7 (AP)The state reported today that New Jersey's population had almost reached the 7.5 million mark.

title: WATER IS TRUCKED TO CAROLINA TOWN
description: LANDRUM, S.C., Jan. 7 (UPI) National Guardsmen trucked drinking water to 2,500 residents of this town in northwestern South Carolina today as workers sought to flush out an industrial contaminant that was dumped into the water system.

description: Wednesday, Jan. 7, 1976 (Prices In N.Y. unless otherwise noted)

title: SPANISH TROOPS RUN SUBWAY IN MADRID
description: MADRID, Jan. 7 (AP)The Spanish Army began running the Madrid subway system today as the Government moved gingerly to break a threeday wildcat strike that set off the worst traffic snarl in the city's history.

title: A.T.&
description: In an attempt to reduce operating costs, the American Telephone and Telegraph Company has dropped its longtime policy of giving thousands of management  level employees costofliving raises. Western Electric, the manufacturing arm of A.T.&T., has imposed a sixmonth moratorium on merit pay increases for its 13,000 managementlevel employees.

title: Behind the Lines Revived By WNET With I.B.M. Grant
description: Behind the Lines, WNET/ Channel 13's journalism review, has been revived because of a $200,000 underwriting grant from the I.B.M. Corporation and is scheduled to be televised on Tuesday nights at 8 beginning Feb. 17.

title: SPECIAL BRITISH UNIT ASSIGNED TO ULSTER
description: LONDON, Jan. 7  Units of the Special Air Service, highly trained British troops, will reinforce the army in Ulster, it was announced tonight.

description: Two major producers of digital watches announced new models yesterday with suggested retail prices as low as, $19.95and even lower prices are expected.

title: Worries on Xerox Held Excessive by Chairman
description: Wall Street's worries about the problems of the Xerox Corporation are excessive, C. Peter McColough, chairman of the businessequipment company, said at a news conference here yesterday.

title: Taxi Commission Rejects Plea By Fleet Owners for Fare Rise
description: The city's Taxi and Limousine Commission yesterday unanimously denied an application for a fare increase requested, by the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade.

title: Youths With Shotgun Hold Up Bus Driver and 3 Riders
description: Four young thugs, one bran dishing a shotgun, boarded Transit Authority bus last night in the BedfordStyvesant section of Brooklyn and held up the driver and his three passengers.

description: (In Pounds sterling per metric ton)

title: Editor Named in Memphis
description: MEMPHIS, Jan. 7 (UPI)Milton R. Britten, who began his career in 1949 as a reporter for The Memphis PressScimitar, was named editor of that newspaper today, succeeding Charles H. Schneider, who is retiring.

title: Wife Recalls A Fire Chief At the Door
description: We had just moved to a new apartment. I was unpacking and thought it was Sears delivering our new refrigerator when I opened the door and saw the fire chief standing there in uniform and then I knew something terrible had happened.

title: CAREY TO CHANGE CLEMENCY SYSTEM
description: A new system of yearround executive clemency for prisoners wit soon be adopted by Governor Carey to replace the traditional granting of elemency only at Christmas, one of his aides said yesterday.

title: DOLLAR STABILIZES IN EUROPE TRADING
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 7 (UPI)The dollar, aided by Swiss central bank intervention, stabilized on European money markets today after sharp losses early in the week.

title: GOLD
description: By The Associated Press

title: Special Elections Slated To Fill 2 Legislature Seats
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Governor Carey today ordered special elections on Feb. 10 in Brook lyn's 18th Senatorial District and in Queens 22d Assembly District to fill vacancies resulting the recent resignation of two legislators.

title: Communists Are the Target Of New Violence in Portugal
description: LISBON. Jan. 7AntiCommunist violence broke out again today in northern Portugal, with bomb attacks against a cooperative for intellectuals and the home of a prominent lawyer.

title: Chess:
description: The sleeping dragon has begun breathing fire. China, for the first time in its history, put a team into international competition by playing host at a 10board, sixround match with the Philippines.

title: The Federal Judge Who Was Ousted in the Reserve Mining Case
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 6Three weeks ago United States District Judge Miles Welton Lord stood before the bench of a Federal Appeals Court. urgently pleading that he be allowed to retain jurisdiction over the nation's longest environmental case. I have become something of an avocate. Judge Lord told six judges of the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit. That is my manner and that is something I can't change. The Senate approved me with that manner. I try not to use it on the bench.

title: Maryland Softens Ban on Jockey
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 7 (AP)  Carlos A. Jiminez, the jockey whose cooperation allowed the United States Attorney's office to prosecute successfully four other riders on racefixing charges, was handed a oneyear suspension today by the Maryland Racing Commission.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ROOTS Indian Drawings and Painted Sketches is a new exhibition of works of the 16th to the 19th centuries from collections in India, Europe and the United States, going on view today through Feb. 29 at Asia House, 112 East 64th Street (between Lexington and Park Avenues).

title: Church Said to Plan Late Primary Race
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Senator Frank Church is preparing a possible late entry into the crowded race for the Demoocratic Presidential nomination and a campaign that would focus on the final primaries before the party's nominating convention.

title: Coast Guard Announces Seizure of a Cuban Vessel
description: BOSTON. Jan. 7 (AP)The United States Coast Guard said tonight that it had seized Cuban fishing vessel 180 miles southeast of here for taking lobsters illegally.

title: St. John's Church Celebrates 150th Year
description: NEWARK, Jan. 7A small, private celebration was held here today to mark the 150th anniversary of the St. John's Church at 24 Mulberry Street, the oldest Roman Catholic Church in Newark and one of the oldest in the state.

title: Retired Colonel Denies Heading C.I.A. Unit for Assassinations
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  A retired Army colonel has denied to Senate investigators an assertion by E. Howard Hunt Jr. that the colonel once headed a Central Intelligence Agency unit set up to arrange for the assassinations of suspected doubleagents.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS TRADING GAINS
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthe counter market posted yesterday their fifth consecutive advance in heavier trading.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Citing budgetary difficulties, the state announced yesterday the postponement of the third phase of the autoemissions testing program for at least a year, until next January. The program began in February 1974. The third phase, which would have taken effect next month, would have further tightened emissions standards.

title: A.P. Sets Price Ranges On Big Board Issues
description: The Associated Press will begin providing consolidated nationwide price ranges in its tables of New York Stock Exchange issues, effective Jan. 19.

title: 2 Soviet Ships Moving Toward Angola Stir Growing U.S. Concern
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Administration officials continued to display urrcertainty today over the mission of two Soviet ships heading south in the Atlantic in the general direction of Angola.

title: WallDancer Adds a New Dimension
description: Trisha Brown, a dancerchoreographer with a lode of fresh ideas that may be conveniently classed as avantgarde, takes her company into the Brooklyn Academy of Music's LePercq Space tonight for a run through Sunday.

title: Windows on RussiaI
description: Russia inhabits our fantasy life. Perhaps because Russia is a riddle wrapped in mystery inside an enigma, as Winston Churchill put it, our image of this country tends to melt into a paranoid dreama theysystem necessary to believe in a wesystem, as Thomas Pynchon described cultural paranoia in Gravity's.

title: The Family Farm
description: Since 1959, the number of familyowned and operated farms has fallen from more than 4 million to 2.82 million and the precipitous decline continues. In part, this reflects the abandonment of marginal, inefficient farms but often the disappearance has been due simply to an inequitable tax situation.

title: Pain and Politics
description: Governor Carey yesterday outlined a program for radical retrenchment in Albany that has farreaching implications for the future of this state and all of its citizens.

title: PRICES INCREASE IN GRAIN FUTURES
description: Corn, wheat and soybeans showed a strong rebound in prices yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. March corn added more than 4 cents a bushel to close at $2.69; March wheat ended at $3.56, up 9 cents a bushel, and march soybeans gained 10 cents to end at $4.74.

title: 3 Exhumations Due Within a Week
description: HACKENSACK, Jan. 7  The bodies of three former hospital patients who may have been murdered 10 years ago by the improper administration of curare will be exhumed within the next seven days and sent to the New York City Medical Examiner's office for testing, Joseph C. Woodcock Jr., the Bergen County Prosecutor, said here today.

title: ParisCaracas Pact Seen
description: PARIS, Jan. 7 (Reuters)The French and Venezuelan governments expect to sign an agreement soon granting landing rights at Caracas for the Concorde officials said today.

title: Party Chiefs Support Cunningham, But Carey Is Silent on Controversy
description: National and state Democratic Party leaders rallied yesterday behind the Democratic state chairman, Patrick J. Cunningham, but Governor Carey pointedly declined to become involved in the politically explosive controversy over his handnicked state chairman.

title: Banks With City Issues Told to Disclose Them
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Securities and Exchange Commission called today for banks holding securities issued by New York City and the new Municipal Assistance Corporation to make substantial new disclosures of the extent of their holdings.

title: FORECLOSURE BEGUN ON McALPIN HOTEL
description: Foreclosure proceedings have been initiated against the McAlpin Hotel, which is operated by a company that is part of the extensive realestate holdings of Sol Goldman and the late Alexander Di Lorenzo Jr.

title: CABINET IN ITALY IS FORCED TO QUIT AS SUPPORT ENDS
description: ROME, Jan. 7The Italian Cabinet resigned tonight, generating political tensions that could lead to national elections this year.

title: Ridge Riley, 68, Official With Penn State, Is Dead
description: Ridge Riley, an official with Pennsylvania State University for more than 90 years, died Tuesday at Center Community Hospital, State College, Pa. He was 68 years old and lived in Boalsburg, Pa.

title: South Africa Reported To Plan Quick Pullout
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)Authoritative Administration sources said tonight that South Africa had informed the United States it was prepared to pull its troops out of Angola in the next 48 hours.

title: JERSEY TO EXPAND BOND INFORMATION
description: New standards of information for investors, resulting from New York City's financial crisis, were set yesterday as New Jersey bowed to demands of bankers for more data in the sale of a $50 million bond issue.

title: U.S. Accuses Chrysler On Emission Controls
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Justice Department charged the Chrysler Corporation with installing improper emission controls in some of the 1974 Plymouth Valiants and Dodge Darts produced at its Hamtramck assembly plant near Detroit.

description: BESSBROOK, Northern Ireland, Jan. 7The tiny front room of the house at 25 Thomas Street was filled with grieving people this morning.
