description: A Yonkers teacher who lost his job during that city's fine:, cial emergency turned up New Year's Eve driving a medallion taxicab in New York City. The teachercabby, Mark Nichik, sent a check for $5 to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and wrote:

title: Group in Bank Bombing Pays for Home Damage
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 19 (UPI)Terrorists who shattered windows in nearby homes with a bomb planted at a Bank of America branch office have sent postal money orders to pay homeowners for 38 broken windows.

title: COURT CRITICIZED IN F.P.C. CASE ROLE
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 19 (UPI) The Supreme Court said today that the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia had improperly injected itself into the workings of the Federal Power Commission.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The two men received Cabinet approval on Sunday for proposal to ban reports on confidential Government diplomatic exchanges and secret meetings. The move followed a series of leaks to newspapers.

title: SAFETY AN ISSUE AT INDIAN POINT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Federal project manager for one of two nuclear reactors 24 miles north of New York City has made potentially serious allegations that both of the plants are unsafe.

title: Kissinger's Mission
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Late on the night of President Ford's State of the Union address, Secretary of State Kissinger flew to Moscow, and the interesting thing about this mission is that the Soviet Government proposed it, suggested first one date, then a second, and finally negotiated ageement on a third.

title: City, Saving $200,000, Drops 12 Jobs in Health Services Unit
description: The city yesterday eliminated 12 positions in the Health Services Administration, which Mayor Beame is dismantling, for an annual savings of nearly $200,000.

title: Hiss Hearst Sees Psychiatrist In Jail Again, Despite Lawyers
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 20While her attorneys prepared for a further attempt tomorrow to block Dr. Harry Kozol from Patricia Hearst's trial, the 22year  old woman submitted quietly today to a resumption of her interview with him.

title: EXFRANKLIN AIDES FILE GUILTY PLEAS
description: A former vice president of the Franklin National Bank and a former foreignexchange trader at the bank pleaded guilty yesterday to charges involving the loss of $30 million in forpionrilrrencv sneculation.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: OLD WAVE The American Indian and the American Flag, a collection of more than 180 historical and contemporary objects, spanning artifacts and everyday items all embellished with design elements inspired by our country's flag and other patriotic symbols is the new exhibition at the American Crafts Council's Museum of Contemporary Crafts. Opening tomorrow and running through March 21, the display was organized by the Flint (Mich.) Institute of Arts and will travel for a year to four major American cities after its premiere here.

title: Nixon Reaudited in Light Of Appraiser's Conviction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 The Internal Revenue Service has begun a reaudit of former President Richard M. Nixon's tax returns for the years in which he claimed a $450,000 deduction for the gift of his VicePresidential papers to the National Archives, to determine if he is liable for fraud penalties, according to sources familiar with the matter.

title: A Princely Designer Gets it All Together For Fashionable Men
description: Men's fashion designers who aspire to generate excitethent through the creation of a total look may have to learn to settle for the achievement of partial success.

title: Cup Skiing Canceled
description: MEGEVE, France, Jan. 20 (AP)The European Cup ski meet scheduled here Jan. 26 through 30 has been canceled for lack of snow, the organizers announced today.

title: Knicks Beat Blazers For Fourth Straight
description: The Knicks shooting slackened at times last night and they made some costly turnovers, but Red Holzman, their coach, was flawless in his moves from the bench.

title: Ship of State
description: In giving his view of the state of the Unionon which we commented briefly yesterdayPresident Ford made it clear that he thinks little more is required of him and or his Administration than to carry forward the policies of the last seven years.

title: FORD FUNDS PLAN ON STATES HAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20After a briefing by President Ford on his 1977 budget today, a bipartisan group of governors and mayors voiced strong support of the President's plans to give the states a freer hand in spending Federal funds for social programs.

title: Decision Near on Disputed Aid to Zaire
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 State Department officials are expected to decide in a few days whether to go ahead despite objections from key Congressional leaders with an emergency loan of $10 million to Zaire, according to Government officials.

title: XEROX PROFIT OFF 5.1% FOR QUARTER
description: Net income, of the Xerox Corporation fell in the fourth quarter and all 1975, the business equipment manufacturer announced yesterday. It was the company's first ??? year earnings decline since 1951.

title: Players Ponder Boycott
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 20 (AP)Preparations for the National Football League Pro Bowl began under a cloud of uncertainty today, with the N.F.L. Players Association refusing to commit itself on a possible player boycott.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The conflict in Lebanon appeared to be widening into a fullscale civil war as Lebanese Moslems and some Palestinian guerrilla forces reportedly besieged or captured a number of towns and villages in the north, east and south. There were charges that a Palestinian brigade had moved in from Syria but there was no confirmation that it had actually joined in the siege. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: FORD FUNDS PLAN ON STATES HAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20After a briefing by President Ford on his 1977 budget today, a bipartisan group of governors and mayors voiced strong support of the President's plans to give the states a freer hand in spending Federal funds for social programs.

title: A Weekend a Month for a Year Is Jail Sentence in Bribe Case
description: The executive vice president of a large construction company who pleaded guilty to attempted bribery was sentenced yesterday to serve one weekend a month for the next 12 months on Rikers Island.

title: Carvalho Arrested
description: Maj. Gen, Otelo Saraiva de Carvalho, a radical leftist who once headed Portugal's Military security and Lisbon region commands, was arrested as a plotter of the Nov. 25 attempted coup. Page 4.

title: Action on Lebanon By Arab League Believed Unlikely
description: CAIRO, Jan. 20Chances of collective mediation by Arab governments in the Lebanese conflict appeared to remain slim today in spite of a new call by Mahmoud Riad, Secretary General of the Arab League, for an emergency meeting of Arab heads of state.

title: TV: A Joffrey Sampler on New Dance in America
description: Public television's new Dance in America series begins this evening at 9 with a repertory sampler from the City Center Joffrey Ballet.

title: Ford's Conservatism
description: President Ford's State of the Union message was carefully designed to win the plaudits of conservatives in his own party, and of businessmen investors and the broad middle class.

title: Reversion in Spain
description: No one could have expected that Spain's political evolution would be easy after 3G years of Generalissimo Franco's authoritarian rule. Whatever their feelings about the monarchy, most Spaniards were willing to give young King Juan Carlos and his Government a period of grace in which to find for the country a safe transition rnutr into thn postFranco ???

title: Sollas Stops Villogas
description: LONDON, Jan. 20 (AP)Vernon Soilas the British featherweight champion, defeated Francisco Villegas of Puerto Rico in a 10round boxing match tonight at the Royal Albert Hall when the referee, Harry Gibbs, stopped the contest after 2 minutes 5 seconds of the seventh round. The 21yearold Scot weighed 125 pounds, the 27yearold Villegas 126.

title: Lawyrs for Youth Convicted of Killing Mother Introduce Prints of a Neighbor
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Jan. 20 Fingerprints found more than two and a half years ago by detectives investigating the murder of Barbara Gibbons have recently been identified and belong to one of the dead woman's neighbors, lawyers seeking a new triad for her on announced in court here today.

title: Colonels 118, Spirits 100
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 20 (UPI)Louie Dampier, held to only 2 points in the first three quarters, scored 14 in the final period as the Kentucky Colonels defeated the Spirits of St. Louis, 118.100, in the A.B.A. tonight.

title: U.S. Says OPEC Revenues For Investment Fell in 1975
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP) The United States Treasury estimates that revenues available for investment and import purchases by oilexporting nations dropped in 1975 but should rise this year.

title: House Approves Statue Of Dr. King in Capitol
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 20The House passed today by a voice vote a resolution to place a statue or bust of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. in the Capitol.

title: Today's Entries at Aqueduct
description: Horses listed in order of root positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: STATE ARTS FUND FACES BUDGET CM
description: A $3 million reduction in funding for the New York State Council on the Arts has been proposed by Governor Carey in the $10.7 billion budget for 197677 that he recommended yesterday. The proposal would reduce the council's per capita requirement, or the amount it is mandated to spend on arts services for each resident of each county, from 75 cents to 55 cents.

title: Learning From Arms Talks With the Soviet
description: ARLINGTON, Va.The recent laments by Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger about the failure of Congress to support his covert policy in Angola add to the evidence that he fails to understand how policy must work in this democracy.

title: Commons Rejects Bill to End Caning In British Schools
description: LONDON, Jan. 20  The House of Commons today rejected a bill to abolish corporal punishment in Britain's schools one of the last vestiges of legalized violence in our society today, according to the bill's sponsor.

title: RAILROADAID BILL GOES TO CONFEREES
description: Senate and House committee leaders agreed yesterday on a $6 billion modified bill to revive the nation's collapsing railroad system and indicated that President Ford was prepared to sign the legislation.

title: Excerpts From Governor Carey's Message to the Legislature on '76'77 Budget
description: I intend this budget to mark a turning point for government in New York State, from heedless expansion to careful retrenchment.

title: About New York
description: The pornographers were in the cutting room, looking at scenes from their dirty movie. One pornographer bit his lip; his wife looked concerned. I'm a nice Jewish girl, she said. Middleclass morality hung over them all.

title: New President Named At McGrawHill Unit
description: John R. Emery, 45 years old and for the last six years president of the McGrawHill Publications Company, resigned suddenly yesterday because of policy differences, the company said.

title: 3 Are Charged With Threats Against Cimpetitor in Suffolk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Jan. 20The owner of one of the largest mobile catering enterprises in Suffolk County and two of his associates were indicted here today on charges that they tried to force an older competitor out of business by threatening him with, among other things, bodily harm.

title: Musical Talents Thrive at Midseason
description: Eight musicals,representing a capital investment of $3.65 million, are scheduled to open on and off Broadway in the remaining half of the 197576 season.

title: Steelmakers Profit Dips; Alcoa Net Plunges 80.3%
description: The nation's fourth and fitth largest steelmakers reported yesterday sharp declines in earnings for the fourth quarter and for the full year.

title: Israelis Held in Gun Sales
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 20 (AP)Four Israelis were arrested today on suspicion of having sold stolen submachine guns to Arab citizens of Israel, a police spokesman said. The guns were definitely not sold to Arab guerrillas, the spokesman said. The Arabs wanted them for selfdefense.

title: Goldin Hires Deputy to Levitt As Deputy Comptroller Here
description: In the midst of the city's attempt at fiscal reformation. Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin announced yesterday that Martin Ives, for more than a decade a chief aide to State Comptroller Arthurs Levitt, would become first deputy city comptroller, replacing Seymour Scher.

title: Plays in Progress Sell Out to Audiences in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Arena Stage, long recognized as a pioneer in the regional theater movement, is now getting its audience into the act with the production of four manuscript works still in the process of development. suoscrtoers, who Doligill out the series within a day after it was announced, are invited to give the play??? and actors instant criticism of their work.

title: A PRESSBAR GROUP PROPOSED ON GAGS
description: The National News Council yesterday proposed formation of a joint committee of journalists and lawyers to concern itself with the question of gag orders issued by judges against the press.

title: Resentment Against U.S. Up in Athens
description: ATHENS, Jan. 20  AntiAmerican feelings, which have been simmering in Greece since the return of democracy 18 months ago, have boiled over again since the murder of Richard S. Welch, the Central Intelligence Agency's chief here.

title: JOBLESSPAY FUND IN RED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Jan. 20Barring an economic miracle, New Jersey will have to borrow $300 million more from the Federal Government in the next year or so to pay state unemployment benefits, Labor and Industry Commissioner Joseph A. Hoffman said today. This would bring the state's debt in this area to more than $700 million.

title: GOVERNOR SEEKING UNCLAIMED ASSETS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20Hundreds of unsuspecting New Yorkers Will become special contributors to Governor Carey's budgetbalancing act next year under Mr. Carey's plan to speed up the collection by the state of millions in assets considered abandoned by their owners in bank accounts, in safe deposit boxes, in utility accounts and in unused traveler's checks.

title: U.S. Overpayments In Welfare Grants Hit $547,000,000
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP) Gross overpayments in the new adult welfare program called Supplemental Security Income have reached $547 million in its first two years of operation and most of the money cannot be collected, the Government said today.

title: Roosevelt Results
Democratic Presidentia.
description: candidates considered him sort of a nuisance and were making a concerted effort to defeat him.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: The manufacturer of BeechNut baby foods recently mailed a flyer to 760,000 mothers warning them about some potential dangers of homemade baby food, including the possibility of poisoning. The flyer was sent, according to the company's president, as a public service.

title: Agricultural Council Questions E.P.A.'s Ban on Several Pesticides
description: The Council for Agricultural Science and Technology, a group that acts as an advisory body to the United States agricultural industry, has published a report questioning the validity of the Environmental Protection Agency's basis for banning several widely used pesticides.

title: Drop for 4th Quarter
description: The Aluminum Company of America reported yesterday that its fourthquarter net income toppled by 80.3 percent to $6.11 million, or 16 cents a share, from $31.04 million, or 91 cents a share in the final quarter of 1974. Sales and revenues of $556.87 million were 15.97 percent lower than the $674.64 million of a year ago.

title: Subcommittee Releases Figures on Stability
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20A House subcommittee recommended today that a subpoena be issued for Federal bank examiners reports on the First National City Bank and the Chase Manhattan Bank.

title: Carter is Regarded As Getting Big Gain From Iowa Results
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Jan. 20 Former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia found himself widely regarded today as a major contender for the Democratic Presidential nomination as late reports from last night's Iowa precinct caucuses gave him a solid victory.

title: Roster Size In N.H.L. Is Cut to 27
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 20Although Clarence Campbell, the league president, thought the move would strengthen the National Hockey League's satellite farm system, the minor leagues took another blow today as the N.H.L. lowered the minimum number of players on a team's reserve list by three.

title: Week's Market Basket
description: Food prices rose 1.3 percent in the New York area last week, the first rise of that magnitude since last May. The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City rose 95 cents for the week, according to the City Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: CuhanLed Angolans Reported Halted
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Jan. 20 (AP)Westernsupported Angolan forces, strengthened by several thousand whites believed to be South Africans, were reported today to be blunting strong southward thrusts by Cubanled rivals.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: DART ATLANTIC (Dart), Antwerp Jan. 31, Southampton Feb. 2, Copenhagen 4 and Dublin 5; sails from Global Marne Terminal, N.J.

title: Prof. Vincent Hopper of N.Y U., Literature Teacher, Dead at 69
description: Vincent Foster Hopper, a specialist in Renaissance literature and professor emeritus of English at New York University, where he had taugnt for 45 years, died of cancer. Monday evening at Presbyterian Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 203 River Edge Road in Tenafly, N. J.

title: General Leaves Brazil Post After Second Prison Death
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Jan. 20 (AP)The ousted commander of the second army here, Gen. Ednardo D'Avila Melo, quietly turned over his commission to an interim commander today, after the death of a second political prisoner in detention under his jurisdiction.

title: Bishop Works as a Mechanic
description: To the man who answers his home telephone, he's the Most Rev. Anthony, Bishop of New York and pastor of the Eastern Orthodox. Monastery of St. Andrew in the Baychester section of the Bronx.

title: Sustained 76 Advance Has Reached 97
description: gainer on the active list, rose 1 to 13. Recent strength in G.M. and Ford, the nation's leading auto makers, has seen more venturesome buying spill over into Chrysler, which once sold as high as 72.

title: Goldwater Says Senate's Panel Went Too Far in C. I. A. Inquiry
description: Senator Barry Goldwater said yesterday that the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence went too far in its investigation into the Central Intelligence Agency and should have spent more time looking into the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Carey Calls for Local Care of the Retarded and Unruly
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20Governor Carey announced today a major program of drastically expanding community  based treatment programs for the mentally ill and retarded and for habitually unruly young people needing supervision.

title: BUSING PROTEST HITS EAST BOSTON SCHOOL
description: BOSTON, Jan. 20 (AP)About 300 persons, including 100 pupils, demonstrated against forced busing at East Boston High School today for about two hours before policemen dispersed them. The police said that two persons had been arrested on disorderly conduct charges.

title: Miss Evert Wins and Dates Ford's Son
description: FAIRFAX, Va., Jan. 20 (UPI)Chris Evert employed her strong baseline strokes tonight to beat young Kathy Kuykendall, 62, 61, in a first round match at the $75,000 Virginia Slims women's tennis tournament.

title: U.S. Has Evidence of Move
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP) The United States has evidence that some Palestinian forces have entered Lebanon from Syria, an Administration official said today.

title: Week's Market Basket
description: Food prices rose 1.3 percent in the New York area last week, the first rise of that magnitude since last May. The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City rose 95 cents for the week, according to the City Department of Consumer Affairs.

title: Pittsburgh Strikers Given a Jail Threat
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 20Albert Fondy, president, and 17 other leaders of the striking Pittsburgh Federation of Teachers were ordered today to appear in court Thursday to show cause why they should not be jailed for defying a backto work order.

title: Bridge:
description: The 40 presidents of the American Contract Bridge League since it was founded in 1937 have not, with few exceptions, been notable as players. But 1975 and 1976 have changed the pattern.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Stage:  Richard II, Inevitable Impasse
description: Richard II is not heroic like Henry V or villainous like Richard III, but a man who plays the king and rejects himself for the role. He is less a ruling monarch than a poetphilosopher, tortured by selfdoubts and constantly commenting on the hollowness of his crown.

title: Pistons 114, Bullets 107
description: LANDOVER, Md. (AP)Archie Clark, playing against his former teammates, scored all his 12 points tonight in the fourth quarter and led the Detroit Pistons to a 114107 victory over the Washington Bullets. Clark, who played three seasons with the Bullets, scored 10 straight as the Pistons increased their lead from 10198 to 111105 with 1:19 to play.

title: New Books
description: All God's Children, by Dorothy Gauchat (Hawthorn Books, $6.95). Experiences with handicapped foster children.

title: DRUG RESEARCH UNDER QUESTION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP) A sixmonth Federal investigation of G. D. Searle & Company has turned up widespread evidence of sloppy research studies that call into question the safety of drugs taken by millions of Americans, of the findings must remain confidential, the Commissionerl said.

title: Carter is Regarded As Getting Big Gain From Iowa Results
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Jan. 20 Former Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia found himself widely regarded today as a major contender for the Democratic Presidential nomination as late reports from last night's Iowa precinct caucuses gave him a solid victory.

title: European Ministers Ready to Resume Spain Trade Talk
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 20The foreign ministers of the Common Market said today that they were ready to resume trade talks with Spain following recent indications from Foreign Minister Josd Maria de Areilza that his Government would pursue a more liberal political policy.

title: Francis Goodwin 2d Dies; Aided Hartford Symphony
description: Francis Goodwin 2d, a founder of the Hartford Symphony Orchestra, died Monday, at his home in Wethersfield, Conn. He was 80 years old.

title: Cooking Mussels (Cont'd)
description: CHAFING DISH MUSSELS WITH. WHITE WINE

title: Nixon Reaudited in Light Of Appraiser's Conviction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Internal Revenue Service has begun a reaudit of former President Richard M. Nixon's tax returns for the years in which he claimed a $450,000 deduction for the gift of his VicePresidential papers to the National Archives, to determine if he is liable for fraud penalties, according to sources familiar with the matter.

title: Ballet: Baiser Revived
description: John Neumeier's version of the Stravinsky ballet Le Baiser de la Fee is dramatically complex, poetically interesting and choreographically disappointing. It was revived last night at the Uris Theater by American Ballet Theater for the first time since the company gave the ballet its American premiere in the summer of 1974. It is a very worthy attempt, and has many literary virtues, to say nothing of some sensitive production values, but even as drama the ballet is oblique, vague and even obscurantist.

title: Justices Curb Shifting of Cases To Ease Load on U.S. Courts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Supreme Court ruled by a vote of 5 to 3 today that heavy caseloads in the Federal courts were not a good enough reason for Federal judges to send cases off to less burdened state courts for trial.

title: Levitt Now Considering the Use of Pension Funds to Save Four State Agencies
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20 State Comptroller Arthur Levitt, in a reversal of the policy he has maintained throughout the fiscal crisis, told Governor Carey today that he was seriously considering the use of state employee pension funds to buy the moral obligation bonds of certain state agencies, a move that would rescue them from a monthbymonth existence on the brink of default.

title: INDICTMENT ASKED IN STARVING DEATH
description: HAVERSTRAW, N.Y., Jan. 20 The case ofa 65yearold resident of an adult home who died of malnutrition last week will be presented to a grand jury tomorrow to determine if there is enough evidence to bring charges of criminally negligent homicide, according to the Rockland County District Attorney, Kenneth Gribetz.

title: CAMBODIA FORCES A NEW MIGRATION, REFUGEES REPORT
description: ARANYAPRATHET, Thailand, Jan. 19Hundreds of thousands of people are being moved from one part of CamboIdia to another, frequently at gunpoint, in a migration that rivals the forced evacuation from Phnom Penh last April, according to Western intelligence sources and interviews here with scores of refugees, some of whom escaped from convoys.

title: Israel Sees Limited Move
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 20Israeli Government sources said today that Palestine Liberation Army forces in Lebanon appeared to have been reinforced during the last 24 hours by Palestinian troops from Syria. But they said that reports of up to 15,1000 1000 additional men seemed grossly exaggerated.

title: Economy's Output Rises at 5.4% Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The economy's recovery from recession prccecded at a good pace in the fourth quarter of last year, though less than half the big spurt in the third quarter, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: For One Caucus in Iowa, 30 Was a Friendly Crowd
description: COUNCIL BLUFFS, Iowa, Jan. 20  The Democratic Party Caucus in the 18th Precinct here was assigned to Mrs. Fulherson's sixthgrade classroom at the Rue School. An ungrammatical rhyme the teacher had clialkocl on the blackboard for her students did double duty last night as an exhortation to the voters. Speak clear! it urged. For all to hear!

title: A Great Ambassador Retires
description: THE HAGUE, the NetherlandsThe United States has been astonishingly well served by its ambassadors during the postwar period, despite an unfortunate habit of stuffing the roster with political hasbeens or fatcats and despite occasional Congressional tendencies to kick around career diplomats or pennypinch their expense allowances.

title: I Can Make it Work
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.New leadership and new people are desperately needed in Washington. Both the President and Congress have failed to come to grips with the real problems that beset, our people. Legislation on critical issues like tax cuts and energy has been too little, too late, The energy crisis, the sluggish economy, high unemployment and inflation are still with us.

title: Jobless Total in Britain Is Highest in Postwar Era
description: LONDON, Jan. 20 (AP)Unemployment in Britain rose by 218,911 people in the month ended Jan. 8 to a total of 1.43 million, or 6.1 percent of the workforce, the Department of Employment reported today. The total was the highest since World War II.

title: Stocks Continue Rise on High Volume As Dow Index Gains 6.14 to 949.86
description: The stock market snruggeo off profit taking pressures once again yesterday and advanced on heavy volume in what has become a familiar scenario in its spectacular climb this year.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times last Friday incorrectly reported the percentage of the contributions to earnings made by the major subsidiaries of the Transamerica Corporation as the subsidiaries percentage gains in earnings in the fourth quarter.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Judge Charles S. Joelson ruled in Superior Court in Paterson that the city's Director of Public Safety, not the Chief of Police, controlled assignments in the Police Department there. Judge Joelson ruled in a suit that William F. Forbes, the Public Safety Director, had the power cancel the appointment of Capt. Robert Mohl as the head of the department's vice squad. Captain Mohl was appointed in November by Police Chief James T. Hannan. Mr. Forbes, who was appointed by Mayor Lawrence Kramer, filed the suit against Chief Hannan to block the annointment of Captain Mohl.

title: TV Journal Assails Ford About Cable
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  A leading television trade journal asked President Ford to make a statement for one of its special editions and then wrote an editorial criticizing the President after the White House refused to delete an indirect reference to the promise of cable television, according to several Government officials.

title: Soviet Six Routs Finland
description: TURKU, Finland. Jan. 20 (AP)The Soviet Union beat Finland, 94, today in a hockey game that served as a warmup for the Innsbruck Winter Olympics.

title: STRIFE IN LEBANON WORSENS AS TOWN FALLS TO MOSLEMS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, Jan. 21The conflict in Lebanon appeared today to be widening into a fullscale civil war as Lebanese Moslems and some Palestinian guerrilla forces reportedly besieged or captured a number of towns and villages in the north, east and south.

title: The Carey Budget
description: In attempting to reconcile conflicting claims of fiscal realities and political pressures, Governor Carey has produced a $10.764 billion budget that falls considerably short of the ideal from either perspective.

title: Cruise Missiles Provoke Conflict Within the Military as Well as With Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The cruise missile, which has developed into one of the key obstacles in the strategic arms negotiations with the Soviet Union, simultaneously has become a controversial object of rivalry between the services and some major defense contractors.

title: Lafayette Beats Columbia, 9572
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Jan. 20 (AP)Todd Tripuolta scored 27 points and led Lafayette to a 9572 basketball victory over Columbia tonight.

title: Joy Manufacturing Co. Admits Illegal Payment
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 20The Joy Manufacturing Company said today that it had made an improper payment in a foreign country.

title: Radio
Microdot is Planning to Sue Irving Trust
description: Microdot Inc.. which has been vigorously fighting a takeover bid by the General Cable Corporation, announced yesterday that it would file suit against the Irving Trust Company. Microdot said that the bank, while doing business with both companies, had agreed to head a $75 million loan arrangement to finance General Cable's tender offer.

title: PRICES DECLINE IN GOLD FUTURES
description: Continued heavy liquidation of gold holdings led to sharply lower gold futures prices on the Commodity Exchange yesterday. The February delivery dropped to a new contract low of $124 1/10 an ounce, down from $127 6/10. During the session it was as low as $123 4/10.

title: CUT IN HOSPITALS CALLED FOR HERE
description: Citing a drastically eroded financial situation, the head of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation has recommended reducing from 15 to 11 the number of acutecare municipal hospitals. The number would be cut over the the next year by the closing of several older hospitals and opening fewer new ones. The number would also be cut by combining existing facilities.

title: WINE TALK
description: Shortly before he died, Frank Schoonmaker sent along a copy of his most recent Almanac of Wine. This pocketsize book, which is not much bigger than an American Express card, is one of the best small compendiums of wine knowledge in existence.

title: Carey's New Strategy
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20Governor Carey's budget, its gap filled not by new taxes but rather by the kinds of devices he was denouncing as gimmicks only few months ago, signals a change not only in his fiscal approach but in his political strategy. Last year, the Governor's aides admit, Mr. Carey did not fare well in the annual budgetary warfare. He gambled on creating a public constituency for the huge tax increases on which his first budget depended, and he lost. The leverage belonged to the Legislature.

title: STOCKS RISE AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market closed higher yesterday in moderately active trading.

title: Court Backs Byrne Plan for Quick Trials
description: TRENTON, Jan. 20 The State Supreme Court, saying that rt was in full sympathy, agreed today that it would cooperate with Governor Byrne in a program to bring criminal defendants to trial within 90 ??? of being charged.

title: Hockey, Basketball Standings
Wales AllStars Win, 75
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 20They're beginning to say the Campbell Conference AllStars can't win the big ones.

title: Cavaliers 98, Celtics 85
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 20 (AP)  Bobby Smith scored 24 points and the Cleveland Cavaliers held onto a big lead with a tenacious defense in posting a 9885 N.B.A. victory over the Boston Celtics tonight. The triumph was Cleveland's second in a row and ended a threegame winning streak by Boston.

title: Theater
description: It should surprise nobody that Panama Hattie, Ethel Merman's first solo starring vehicle back in 1940, has been appealingly revived by the Equity Library Theater, 103d Street at Riverside Drive.

title: CREDIT MARKETS REMAIN IN SLUMP
description: As the Open Market Committee met in Washington yesterduy to set monetary policy for the next month, the credit markets remained in their slump. Fixedincome security prices aecimeo even though the Federal Reserve came into the market to purchase couponbearing Treasury issues that mature after March. A new $100 million issue of Aaarated utility bonds yieldMg more than an Aarated issue marketed last week did not sell quickly. St. Paul failed to get any bids for $23 million of notes.

title: OTB Big Loser On Entry Error
description: The track was fast at Aqueduct yesterday despite the snow. The problem was offtrack. Because of a mistake in the overnight entries. New York's Offtrack Betting Corporation had to refund 5151,594 in bets made at its 152 offices on the Big A's daily double and another $22,806 on the second race's win, place and show wagering.

title: 460 in A.S.P.C.A. Said to Join in Suit Against the Society
description: Two women who instituted a suit last year against the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, charging the organization with neglect of stray animals and mismanagement of funds, and inadequate fund raising, announced yesterday that they had been joined in their suit by 460 of the 1,000 members of the organization.

title: Barbara N. Armstrong, 85, Law Professor at Berkeley
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 20 (UPI)Barbara N. Armstrong, believed to have been the first woman law professor in the United States, died Sunday. She was 85 years old.

title: Aid for Jobless Held Haphazard
description: HACKENSACK, Jan. 20Several Bergen County residents say that unemployment benefits are being administered Haphazardly by the State Unemployment Office here.

title: Shapp Hits Ford Talk
description: ??? ??? a ??? Presidential candidate, condemned today President Ford's State of the Union address as a little Reagan plan that would put one million more Americans out of work.

title: Chargers Drop Svare
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 20 (AP)Harland Svare was dismissed Today as general manager of the San Diego Chargers, a post he held since 1971, and he immediately blamed a psychiatrist's book about him. [In New Orleans, Hank Stram signed a $1 millionplus, fiveyear contract as head coach of the Saints.]

title: Court Refuses to Release Reluctant Hoffa Witness
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 20 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit denied bail today and refused to overturn a contempt citation against Stephen Andretta, key Government witness in the investigation of the disappearance of James R. Hoffa, former Teamster union leader.

title: A Catholic School Ponders Kennedy and Morality
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa, Jan. 20David A. Walker looked down the yellow cementblock west wall of the crowded library at three pictures and said that the question before the school board was, Does the picture of Jack Kennedy and his wife and his inaugural address belong in Notre Dame High School in Burlington, Iowa, today?

title: Rare Forest Fire on Coast
description: SONORA, Calif., Jan. 20 (UPI) A rare January forest fire in the Stanislaus National Forest was reported today as California's summerlike weather left the range dry and dusty instead of shrouded in snow. A 45acre blaze was burning in brush, grass and timber in the mountains between Sonora and Yosemite National Park. A spokesman for the United States Forest Service said the blaze was discovered yesterday. Sixtyfive men were attempting to bring it under control.

title: Council and Students Fight to Save Life of Adult Classes
description: One of the latest casualties of the budget crisis for this city of immigrants is an adulteducation program that for128 years has helped its newcomers prepare for citizenship.

title: Guerrilla Reports Entry
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 20 (Reuters)George Habash, leader of the Marxistoriented Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine said tonight that troops of the Palestine Liberation Army had entered Lebanon from Syria.

title: Gold
description: Selected world gold prices Tuesday. London: Morning fixing 5126.00, down $2.90; afternoon fixing $121.60, down $4.30.

title: U.N. Agency to Quit Beirut
description: VIENNA, Jan. 20 (Reuters)The United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine refugees in the Middle East is to move its headquarters temporarily from Beirut to Vienna, an agency spokesman said today. He said the move had been decided upon because of the fighting in Beirut.

title: Cutting 15 of City's Hospitals To 11 Urged by Dr. Holloman
description: Citing a drastically eroded financial situation, the head of the city's Health and Hospitals Corporation has recommended reducing from ??? to 11 the number of acutecare muipal hospitals. The number would be cut over the the next year by the closing of several older hospitals and opening fewer new ones. The number would also be cut by combining existing facilities.

title: Dessoff Choirs Skillfully Crafts Minor Schubert
description: Schubert composed hundreds of works in his short life and an amazing proportion of them hold a firm place in the affection of musicians as well as in the standard repertory. But, while there are dozens of pieces that we simply could not do without, there also are dozens of others that sound puzzlingly mediocre, works that now retain only curiosity value. Still, knowing what a hill looks like is a help in understanding a mountain.

title: Both Parties Follow Election Unit's New Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20Both major parties are telling their Presidential and Congressional candidates to follow regulations drafted by the Federal Election Commission, despite the fact that they have not been cleared by Congress.

title: Church in Bay Ridge Is Destroyed by Fire
description: A Greek Orthodox church in Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn was destroyed by a fire that raged out of control, for more than three hours last night and this morning.

title: Economists Mixed On State of Union
description: President Ford received some applause and sonic criticism Yesterday from a cross section of economists and businessmen risked yesterday about how they viewed the proposals in his State of the Union message.

title: People in Sports
description: Jon Matlack, who won 16 games last year, the most victories in his four years in the major leagues, has agreed to a contract with the Mets for 1976. Terms were not announced, but the lefthanded pitcher is believed to be in the 875,000880,000 range. Matlack, who celebrated his 26th birthday on Monday, posted a 1612 wonlost record, 3.38 earnedrun average and was the winning pitcher in the AllStar game.

title: HUGHES RELIEVED OF SHIP TAX CLAIM
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 20A Federal district judge dismissed yesterday a $7.5 million Los Angeles County tax claim against Howard R. Hughes's Summa Corporation on the ground that the Federal Government, not Summa was the owner of the ship Glomar Explorer.

title: GLADYS GODDARD
description: Gladys Benjamin Goddard, who wrote a biography of Enrico Caruso, the tenor, who was her brotherinlaw, died Sunday in Tryon, N.C., where she lived. She was 94 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: Martin Green has got it into his head that all the English boys who hated games at school played at being dandies, rogues, naifs and Pierrots instead. Children of the Sun is subtitled A Narrative of Decadence in England after 1918, and for all the famous names it invokes, like a nun telling her beads, it is very slow going.

title: CARTER CAMPAIGNS IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: I'm Jimmy Carter, said Jimmy Carter, thrusting his hand at one of the insurance workers at the lines of grey steel dellts. I'd like y'all to help me become President.

title: Helping Parents to Absorb New Findings on Childhood
description: Dr. Fred Streit, a psycholoeist, sounded hopping mad. Did you ever try to read that stuff? he asked heatedly. The jargon in those things! It infuriates me. urbum, who teacnes research methods to graduate students at Rutgers University, was talking about most of the research published on childrearing and child development. He says that when he talks to educators he finds few of them who are up on the research  and parents know even less. He blames the arcane quality of research writing.

title: He Advocates Mussels as a Delicious Answer to Food Shortages

We snuggled more deeply into a quilted skijacket, wiggled our toes In a pair of borrowed oversize rubber boots and tried to coordinate fingers to pad as C. title: Angie Doesn't Believe Ali's Firsties
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Jan. 20Angelo Dundee has devoted almost 20 years to the care and feeding of Muhammad Ali, and if he doesn't rank today as the greatest living authority on the heavyweight champion of the world, then he is the second greatest. Both have aged since Angelo made the acquaintance of a 16yearold from Louisville named Cassius Clay, and both have grown  the fighter in size and wealth, the trainer in wisdom. If there is a sinele creature who knows more than Angelo about the mind and body and spirit of the noted Thespian, it is Muhammad Ali. Among the many things Angelo has learned is that ha must never believe Muhammad's firsties. And sometimes not his seconds and thirdies, he said today. The first time he says or does something, Angie said, he's just trying it out for effect. Like one time we went to Los Angeles for a fight hnd the hotel rooms weren't ready and the gym wasn't fixed up. We're going home, Muhammad said, and started to get in the car for the airport. Don Fraser, who was handling the fight, almost had a heart attack. I said, the first two, three days you're just going to loosen up and run. You don't need a ring because you're not going spar, and you don't need a hag because you're not going to punch it. He said, Alright, and that was all, but Fraser just about had a heart attack.

Last year, the Governor's aides admit, Mr. Carey did not fare well in the annual budgetary warfare. He gambled on creating a public constituency for the huge tax increases on which his first budget depended, and he lost. The leverage belonged to the Legislature.

description: OXFORD, Mass., Jan. 21 (AP) A truck, apparently skidding on an icy road, and a school bus collided today, slightly injuring 11 students and the bus driver.

title: Fiscal Abuses in State Family Agency Alleged in Report by Legislative Office
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21The Office of Fiscal Affairs said today that there was widespread fiscal mismanagement involving several million dollars in the New Jersey Youth and Family Services Division.

title: Farm Magazine Chiefs Publishers of the Year
description: At the Magazine Publishers Association, 1976 might just be remembered as the year of the farmer. Not one but two heads of farm publications are being named Publisher of the Year by the association.

title: Yugoslays Spur Drive Against Dissent
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 21A threeyearold Yugoslav policy of stiffening enforcement of the official Communist line has grown increasingly stern in recent months.

title: Muskie Rebuttal Assails Ford on Jobs and Prices
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 21Senator Edmund S. Muskie, charging that. President Ford's economic plans were penny wise and poundfoolish, urged tonight a rejection of those who, he said, counsel go back and give up.

title: ASSEMBLY BACKS SCHOOLCUT LIMIT
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The Assembly today passed legislation, strongly opposed by the City administration, requiring the city to appropriate a fixed proportion of its expense budget to the city school system.

title: N.B. A. Adds Reserves to Star Teams
description: Alvan Adams, the Phoenix Funs center, will be the only firstyear player in the National Basketball Association AllStar game on. Feb. 3 at the Spectrum in Philadelphia.

title: Alcoholism Among Women Reported to Be Increasing
NADJARI IS ASSAILED BY COUNCILWOMAN
description: Aileen B. Ryan, Councilwoman at Large from the Bronx, yesterday denounced Maurice H. Nadjari's investigation of Patrick J. Cunningham, the state Democratic chairman, and called for reform of the office of special prosecutor.

title: The President's Gamble
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford's budget without illusion is built around big election year gamble, a belief that the President can per suaae voters to News lower their expectations of what Analysis government can do for them. The budget proposal that Mr. Ford sent today to Capitol Hill would lower spending on education, make the aged pay more for health care, raise Social Security payroll taxes and remove pressure on the states to find money to help the disadvantaged. It calls for major new spending only for energy projects and the military.

title: SAIGON RETURNS TO CIVILIAN RULE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 21 (Reuters)The Saigon military Government, headed by Gen. Tran Van Tra, was today replaced by a civilian administration.

title: Office in India Is Hopeful
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 21As long as Washington is kind to us, I am still in business, said Sharada Navak. secretary of the Educational Resources Center, a modest cultural operation. snonsored by the State of New York in this city.

title: Snow Snarls Roads
description: Snow fell on the metropolitan area yesterday, causing icy roads and tying up traffic. Page 29.

title: Snow Snarls Roads
description: Snow fell on the metropolitan area yesterday, causing icy roads and tying up traffic. Page 29.

title: City Striving to Reopen Libraries with U.S. Aid
description: City officials and trustees of the New York Public Library yesterday developed a tentative plan that would, if approved, result in the reopening of seven branch libraries that were closed as an austerity measure last week.

title: Bernard Ridder Stabbed
description: PASADENA, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP)Bernard J. Bidder, chairman of the board of Bidder Publications Inc., was in good condition at a hospital today today after being stabbed in robbery attempt at Hollywood Park racetrack, the police said. Investigators said that he was stabbed last night after a horse auction.

title: Ralbovsky First In Soccer Draft
description: Steve Ralbovsky, a twotime allAmerica midfielderdefender from Brown University, was selected by the Los Angeles Skyhawks yesterday as the No. 1 player in the American Soccer League draft here.

title: Visa for Dissident
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21 (Reuters) The mathematician Aleksandr Lunts, one of Moscow's most active Jewish dissidents., learned today he was being allowed to emigrate to Israel.

title: Anne Dunning Has Nuptials
description: Christ Episcopal Church in Creenwich, Conn., was the setting yesterday evening for the marriage of Anne. Newton Dunning of New Canaan. Conn., to Roger O. Walther. president of the American Institute for Foreign Study in Greenwich. The Rev. Samuel C. Walker performed the ceremony.

title: E. P. A. PLANS CUTS ON WATER CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Ford Administration has worked out a legislative formula to avoid most of a staggering, if highly theoretical, outlay of $440 billion to eradicate water pollution from the country.

title: The Pop Life
description: The exhibition rooms on the mezzanine of the normally sedate Roosevelt Hotel are echoing with sounds of the midnight hour this week.

title: TV Newsman Spied On Russians in U.N
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21A former television correspondent has told the Senate intelligence committee that, while covering the United Nations in the late 1950's and early 1960's, he also reported regularly to the Federal Bureau of Investigation on the activities of the Soviet delegation to the United Nations.

title: Frei Against the Junta
description: Chile's most respected political leader of recent times, former President Eduardo Frei, has delivered a savage attack on the military dictatorship of Gen. Augusto Pinochet and projected a democratic alternative for that stricken country. In effect, Mr. Frei calls on the armed forces to throw out the governing junta in order to prevent a regime with many totalitarian characteristics from being fastened on Chile.

title: Ford Defers a Spacecraft
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (Reuters)The United States has decided for economy reasons to postpone production of a third space shuttle orbiter this year, President Ford announced today. The postponement will save $90 million in the budget year beginning next October, Mr. Fad said. The first shuttle is to be launched in 1979.

title: MABEL RICE PARKER
description: Mabel Rice Parker, the wife of Philo W. Parker, former board chairman and president of the former StandardVacuum Oil Company, died yesterday at her home at 120 East End Ave. nue, She was 84 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

The President's Gamble
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford's budget without illusion is built around big election year gamble, a belief that the President can persuade voters tolower their expectations of what government can do for them. The budget proposal that Mr. Ford sent today to Capitol Hill would lower spending on education, make the aged pay more for health care, raise Social Security payroll taxes and remove pressure on the states to find money to help the disadvantaged. It calls for major new spending only for energy projects and the military.

title: LONGTM DONOR AIDS THE NEEDIEST
description: A check earmarked to help an elderly person was received yesterday by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund. It was for $25 and came from Mrs. John H. Kayton of Manhattan, who wrote:

title: Excerpts From Democratic Reply to Ford Given by Senator Muskie
description: I have just returned from two intensive weeks of travel; listening and talking among my people back home in Maine. We talked about a lot of very serious problems which are shared by millions of Americans from coast to coast.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Open Interest
Farmers to Increase Corn Planting 4%
description: WASHINGTON', Jan. 21 (AP) The nation's farmers, on the heels of a record harvest in 1975, intend to lift 1976 corn plantings 4 percent when they do their planting this spring, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Nadiari's Bronx Inquiry
description: While public attention has focused on allegations by, Maurice H. Nadjari about the sale of judgeships in the Bronx, another kind of transaction in that boroughin

title: Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Ford Administration, convinced that a recovering economy will solve much of the nation's housing needs, said today that it intended to hold housing expenditures at present levels.

title: Notes on People
description: Defending his stand against abortion and his recent condemnation of extramarital Sex. Pope Paul VI described yesterday as indecorous and Sacrilegious a recent invasion of Milan's cathedral by 300 feminists.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: WINDS DRIVE FLAMES NEAR NIXON'S HOME
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 21 (UPI)A brush fire, fanned by dry winds with velocities up to 40 miles an hour, roared out of the Camp Pendleton Marine Base today into the neighborhood of former President Richard M. Nixon and destroyed or damaged 29 structures.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The State Commissioner of Motor Vehicles announced that all state driving licenses and motor vehicle registrations expiring on Saturday, Jan. 31, would be extended until midnight, Feb. 2. A spokesman explained that all of the department's offices would be closed on Saturday and it was the policy to extend expiration dates to the following Monday when the last day of the month fell on a Saturday or holiday.

title: Byrne Reiterates His Pledge to Close Trenton Prison;
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21Governor Byrne today repeated pledge he made when he first took office two years agoto make the closing of the Trenton State Prison a monument to my administration.

title: Yugoslays Spur Drive Against Dissent
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 21A threeyearold Yugoslav policy of stiffening enforcement of the official Communist line has grown increasingly stern in recent months.

title: Wisconsin Gag on Media Requested in Indian Trial
description: JUNEAU, Wis., Jan. 21 (UPI) Circuit Judge Henry G. Gergen Jr. took under advisement today a request for a gag order in the trial of five Indians charged in 1st year's armed takeover of the former Alexian Brothers novitiate near Gresham. Wis.

title: Thank Heaven for Little Girls
description: SterettGittings Kelsey names her sculptures at random after friends and relations, a custom she initiated with her first big show in Greenwich, Conn., five years ago. Asked to produce 40 titles In half an hour, she scribbled down the names of 40 people she knew and assigned them to her figures irrespective of sex.

title: CAREY WOULD AID TENANT PAYMENTS
description: yesterday that he would ask for a $22 million appropriation to help pay the rent and carrying charges of elderly and poor families who cannot afford the rising costs at middleincome housing developments that get city and state aid.

title: Appalachian Area Request Raised to $298.5 Million
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) President Ford, in his budget request to Congress today, asked $298.5 million for the programs of the 13state Appalachian Regional Commission.

title: Brooklyn Auction Seeks Funds To Aid 7 Cultural Institutions
description: A benefit auction is growing in Brooklyn. It is an ambitious event that will put on the block such hardtoget items as a performance by the comedian Sam Levenson, a party on an old Chinese junk, Kay Mazzo's ballet shoes and an organically homegrown luncheon for two in the penthouse garden of the millionaire Stewart R. Mott.

title: Corporate Sector Posts Best Rise
description: The credit markets, which have been muddling along for the last week seeking to find a sense of direction, posted a fairly solid advance yesterday. Fixedincome investors, group that is always sensitive to inflation, apparently were reassured by the news that the Consumer Price Index showed a smaller increase in December than in November and completed 1975 with the smallest rise since 1972.

title: Ranger Puts In Rebound With 0:20 to Play
description: By the sound of the crowd, you'd think the Rangers had won the Stanley Cup last night at Madison Square Garden. What they did, however, was salvage a 33 tie in the last 20 seconds against the stingy Chicago Black Hawks, end a threegame losing streak and make Coach John Ferguson's first appearance at home a housewarming.

title: A Loan For Chile?
description: WASHINGTONThe World Bank has before it a proposal to lend $33 million to the Chilean Government for investment in coppermining facilities. The bank's president, Robert S. McNamara, has recommended the loan. It is scheduled to go before the board of directors for final approval next Tuesday.

title: Slow but Steady Recovery Forecast With Modest Drop in Unemployment
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Ford Administration forecasts a moderate reduction of unemployment, a further slackening in the rate of inflation and a 6.2 percent growth in the total output of the economy this year. it was disclosed today.

title: Advertising
description: Nestle, part of a worldwide food company, has since October been moving into the United States soup market.

title: 3 STATES DEPLORE HEALTH FUND CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Officials of New York. New Jersey and Connecticut declared today that President Ford's budget proposals would cost their states and cities millions of dollars in health funds, and predicted that this would compel the elimination of many hitherto federally funded programs in education, social services and health.

title: U.S. Plans Alternative Nuclear Fuel Industry Using a New Process
description: The United States Government announced yesterday a major step toward creating a multibillion  dollar alternative nulcear fuel enrichment industry in the 1980's. This would use the socalled centrifuge process that has been under intensive and largely secret development for more than 15 years.

title: Guide
description: DIFFERENT TUNE The British are comingtonight at 7:30 to Madison Square Garden as the Royal Marines and the Black Watch perform a regimental tribute to the Bicentennial and handsacrossthesea friendship in a program of pomp, pageantry, massed bands, pipes, drums and dances. One highlight will be a Yankee Doodle Dandy number, while another will feature soldiers in uniforms of the Revolutionary period. The Royal Marines will demonstrate their famed precision marching and the Watch's Highland dancers will go into their spectacular sword dancing.

title: Eban May Soon Be Rejoining the Israeli Cabinet
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 21Abba Eban, Israel's former foreign mimister, may soon be joining the Government as a deputy prime minister or minister without portfolio.

title: Proposed Cuts Linked to Future Savings
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford's budget proposes about $20 billion in reductions or savings in various Federal programs for the fiscal year 1977, changes that will produce significantly larger savings in subsequent years. Most of the reductions would require an act. of Congress to change existing law, which Congress in the past has been reluctant to do. Some would simply permit expiration of existing lawsmainly recessionborn programs involving the unemployedwhich Congress may want to extend. few can be made administratively by the President. The following are the major items:

title: Ambulance Funds Sought
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Jan. 21 (UPI)The Black Panthers say they will try to raise $30,000 by April so they can restart their free ambulance service here. The People's Free Ambulance Service, begun with a $35,000 grant from the National Episcopal Church, ceased operations yesterday after operating for two years.

title: Social Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21President Ford's proposed plan to consolidate 59 programs into four block grants to states totaling $18.2 billion is the beginning in earnest of a pendulum swing back from years of the Federal Government's defining the scope of and solutions to seemingly intractable social programs.

title: American in the Red
description: Two of the nation's largest airlines. Trans World Airlines and American Airlines, reported yesterday massive deficits for the fourth quarter of 1975 and for the full year. rans world said it incurred a pretax loss of $44.1 million in the fourth quarter of 1975 and a pretax loss of $121.4 million for the full year on its airline operations. Its domestic traffic operated at pretax loss of $101 million, during 1975 while its international traffic resulted in pretax loss of $23.5 million.

title: Device That Sees Into Arteries Offers Clues to Heart Attacks
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan. 21 (AP) A new way of seeing inside human arteries has been developed that could help doctors determine whether changes in lifestyle can prevent premature heart attacks, according to specialist.

title: Israel Said to Strengthen Its Forces Facing  Lebanon
description: The Israeli military was reported yesterday to be taking precautionary measures to strengthen northern frontier areas against possible forays from Lebanon by Palestine Liberation Army forces.

title: Sales Are Also Down
description: The Reynolds Metals Company reported yesterday sizable declines in sales and net income for the fourth quarkor and the year.

title: College and School Results
description: British Football Results

title: RANKERS TRUST SUED IN CLASS ACTION HERE
description: A class action lawsuit has been filed in Federal District Court. here charging the Bankers Trust Company and its parent, the Bankers Trust New York Corporation, numerous oficers and Ernst & Ernst, its accounting firm, with presenting a falsely inflated and optimistic picture of the bank since about 1973.

title: Witness at Carson Trial Gives Conflicting Accounts to Jury
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) President Ford will undergo his annual physical examination on Saturday at the Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Md., the White House press secretary, Ron Nessen, said today.

title: Arrival in Rio
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 21The Air France Concorde roared into the international airport here today, inaugurating supersonic passenger jet service. But the plane was 40 minutes behind schedule be cause of a refueling delay and a brief technical failure that forced it to reduc its speed temporarily.

title: Blues Hand Scouts 10th Loss in Row
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 21 (UPI)  Derek Sanderson scored while St. Louis was two men short in the second period tonight and assisted on a firstperiod powerplay goal in leading the St. Louis Blues to a 42 National Hockey League victory over Kansas City, hours after Bep Guidolin, the Scouts coach, resigned.

title: PARKING
description: Motorists will be able to park their cars today on both sides of those streets where alternatesideofthestreet regulations are normally in effect. The regulations have been suspended because of snow. However, other parking and standing restrictions still apply.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Wednesday.

title: Andrews Sound at the Mall
description: PARAMUS, Jan. 21The stars of Over Here, which opens Friday night at the Playhouse here on the Bergen Mall, have a problem.

title: 12 Big Bank Companies on Problem List Of 35 at the Federal Reserve a Year Ago
description: Twelve of the nation's 50 largest bank holding companies, widely scattered across the country, were placed on a confidential problem list by the staff of the Federal Reserve Board a year ago.

title: Staten Island Transit Strike Enters Its Seventh Week
description: Ed Reichick, who owns a liquor store in the St. George ferry terminal on Staten Island, was slumped in a chair at the shoemaker's shop across the hall the other night, shaking his head with obvious dismay.

title: Ford's Budget Message Proposes Spending Cuts and. Tax Relief
For Palestinian Independence and Sovereignty
description: The Security Council's debate on the Middle East is predicated upon certain recognized facts: that peace will not prevail in the Middle East until the Palestinian people realize their national rights, including repatriation, selfdetermination and independence in Palestine: that Palestinian participation in United Nations efforts leading toward peace is absolutely indispensable and that, accordingly, the Palestine Liberation Organization, which is internationally recognized as the legitimate representative of the Palestinian people, was asked and is now participating in the current deliberations of the Council; and that the continuing stalemate in the Middle East, caused by the Zionist insistence on frustrating the internationally recognized national rights of the Palestinian people, will lead to yet another conflict.

title: Snow Base Called A Basic Condition
description: HUNTER, N.Y.Two winters ago, some operatorsparticularly in New England began omitting snow bases at their ski areas in issuing their ski reports. They took the stand that News snow depths were not necessarily of important in reSkiing porting ski conditions. Last Monday, Israel Slutzky, a coowner of the Hunter Mountain ski area and also a busy civil engineer, took issue with such an approach. He insisted that a policy of failing to report snow depths seemed to be an attempt in some cases to camouflage ski reports.

title: Scout Pilot Quits Over Dispute
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 21 (UPI)Bep Guidolin resigned as coach of the National Hockey League's Kansas City Scouts today, complaining that the team's executives had refused to give him the necessary support.

title: Research Finds Peril to Lungs In Heavy Marijuana Smoking
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI) A study by a California medical team raises the possibility that heavy marijuana smoking can harm the lungs. Dr. Donald P. Tashkin and coworkers at the School of Medicine of the University of California, Los Angeles, found in a study of 28 healthy young male marijuana smokers that customary social use of marijuana did not produce a noticeable respiratory effect  but that heavy smoking did.

title: Blacks Urge Julian Bond as President
description: Leaders of the National Black Political Assembly announced yesterday that they intended to draft State Senator Julian S. Bond of Georgia as an independent candidate for President of the United States.

title: ABUSES ARE FOUND IN JERSEY AGENCY
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21The Office of Fiscal Affairs said today that there was widespread fiscal mismanagement involving several million dollars in the New Jersey Youth and Family Services Division.

title: Light Snow Crows Into a Storm; Snarling City and Suburb Roads
description: Snow fell lightly on the metropolitan area during the. day yesterday, thenas if it had whimsically been waiting for just the momentbegan to pelt down as hundreds of thousands of commuters emerged from their offices for the trek home.

title: Fender, ArmyBred Star, Is Eager to Serve as Coach
description: Mel Pender wants the Army. But does the Army want Mel Pender? Winner of an Olympic gold medal and probably the quickest starter off the mark in dash history, Pender has been the United College States Military Academy's acting Sports track coach since Notes the death of Carl. Crowell last Sept.

title: 35th Crosby Golf Will Start Today
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 21  If politics makes strange bedfellows, the politicians may have learned the art of improbable combinations from the institution of the proamateur golf tournament.

title: JOHN N. NICHOLLS, 71, CHOIRMASTER, DEAD
description: John N. Nicholls, a longtime choirmaster who was the organist for 18 yeears at Our Lady of Pompeii Church at 25 Carmine Street, died Tuesday, or a heart attack at his home at 10103 Flatlands Avenue in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn. He was 71 yearsold.

title: Hearst Defense Rebuffed Again In Attempt to Bar Psychiatrist.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 21Patricia Hearst's defense was rebuffed today for the second time in attempting to block Dr. Harry Kozol. a Boston psychiatrist, from bean; a prosecation witness against her.WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI) In an apparent how to feminist objections, the fiscal year 1977 budget avoids the word manpower in describing Federal job training and employment projects. This word change has no effect on the composition of the function [of such programs], the budget explained.

title: TV: The Kind of Show a Star Should Never Do
description: Mary. our Mary, of The Mary Tyler Moore Show gets. to star in her very own hourlong special tonight at 10 on CBSTV. That's the kind of thing a star can do when TV fame and fortune are invested in a successful production company called MTM Enterprises Inc. Of course, Mary's Incredible Dream is precisely the kind of thing a star should not do, ever. It is a fiasco. In its misguided way, it may set a landmark in TV vulgarity.

title: TV Newsman Spied On Russians in U .N
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21A former television correspondent has told the Senate intelligence committee that, while covering the United Nations in the late 1950's and early 1960's, he also reported regularly to the Federal Bureau of Investigation on the activities of the Soviet delegation to the United Nations.

title: `CONFUSION CITED IN CRASH OF JET
description: A Trans World Airlines jet slammed into a mountain near Dulles International Airport in 1974 because of miscalculation by the crew, which resulted from longstanding confusion in air  traffic  control procedures, the National Transportation Safety Board reported yesterday.

title: Lewis Rosenstiel, Founder Of Schenley Empire, Dies
description: Lewis S. Rosenstiel, founder of Schenley Industries Inc., the giant liquor corporation, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital in Miami Beach at the age of 84. He suffered a stroke in 1971 and was partly paralyzed.

title: Plan to Drill for Oil in Park Creates Dispute in Houston
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 21What would happen if a big oil company announced plans to drill some wildcat oil wells in New York's Central Park? Well, the roadshow version of just such a saga is trying out in Houston.

title: Ondine Takes Lead In Ocean Yachting
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 21 (UPI)  The two frontrunners in the CapetowntoRio yacht race, Ondine of the United States and Pen Duick VI of France, have found fresh trade winds and sailed more than 200 miles in the last 24 hours, according to radio reports received today by the race guard ship Protea.

title: Burroughs Raises Dividend
description: The Burroughs Corporation increased the quarterly dividend on its common stock to 17 cents a share from 15 cents. The dividend is payable May to shareholders of record April 9.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES TO AIR SPY DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP). The House Intelligence Committee voted today to publish secret information on United States intelligence operations in its final report. A spokesman for President Ford suggested that the committee was breaking an agreement that Mr. Ford would have to approve such disclosures.

title: U.S.SOVIET TALKS SAID TO PROGRESS
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21Both the Soviet Union and the United States were reported tonight to have made some concessions toward resolving the deadlock over a strategic arms agreement.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Celtics Triumph, 114 to 100
description: BOSTON, Jan. 21 (UP1)Steve Kuberski scored a seasonhigh 20 points in just 23 minutes of play tonight to lead the Boston Celtics to a 114100 National Basketball Association victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: Sanford Is Quitting Presidential Race
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 21  Terry Sanford, president of Duke University and former Governor of North Carolina, has decided to drop out of the race for the Democratic nomination for President. The decision, disclosed by a source close to Mr. Sanford, was described as based on the political realities.

title: Roosevelt Results
description: WESTBURY, L.I.

title: VARIANCE FOUND IN GAS RESERVES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21A Congressional subcommittee charged today that an independent Federal survey of 153 areas under the Gulf of Mexico had found 37.4 percent more natural gas than estimated by the industry.

title: How a $9.4 Billion Deficit Increased to $43.6 Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 President Ford's budget today contained a detailed explanation of what went wrong in the budget year that ended last June 30 to convert an originally estimated deficit of $9.4 billion to an actual deficit of $43.6 billion.

title: U.S. Convicts Head Of American Beef On Fraud Charges
description: OMAHA, Jan. 21 (AP)Frank R. West, builder of one of the nation's largest meat slaughtering companies, was sentenced today to 24 concurrent twoyear prison terms after being convicted in Federal Court of mail and wife fraud. However, Mr. West's sentence was suspended and he was placed on two years probation.

title: Christian Town Burns After Fall in Lebanon
description: DAMUR, Lebanon, Jan. 21 This once proud town of 15,000 Christians, perched on a hill overlooking orange groves and the Mediterranean, is a smoking ruin.

title: Burns Questions Irving Trust Actions
description: The chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, Arthur F. Burns, said yesterday that he questioned the actions of the Irving Trust Company in the General Cable Corporation's bid to take over Microdot Inc.

title: SHAPP IS REPORTED  UNDER F.B.I. STUDY
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Jan. 21 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation apparently has opened an inquiry into how and why the Williamsport City Council awarded a 25year franchise to a cable television company owned by Milton J. Shapp, shortly before he became Governor of Pennsylvania.

title: Problem List a Surprise For Many Bank Officers
description: Many banking officers expressed surprise yesterday when informed that their company had been listed a year ago on a Federal Reserve tabulation of problem banks.

title: WAR IN LEBANON SPREADS AS SYRIA SEEKS A SOLUTION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Thursday, Jan. 22Palestinian guerrillas and their Lebanese Moslem and leftist allies pressed their offensive in several parts of the country yesterday as a highlevel Syrian mediation mission arrived in Beirut.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Fighting by Whites and Blacks Shuts Boston's Hyde Park High
description: BOSTON. Jan. 21 (UPI)Black and white students fought with fists and chairs at Hyde Park High School todey and the School Superintendent, Marion Fahey, ordered the school closed tomorrow.

title: For Children, Play About the Joy of Mud
description: Many children revel in the words of Polly Chase Boyden's poem which begins: Mud is very nice to feel The musical play, Dirty Ferdie Comes Clean, goes further. Ferdie dreams that he is in a place where he never has to take a bath or otherwise concern himself with cleanliness. He dutifully learns, however, that it's better to come clean.

title: SHELL TO CUT PRICES ON GAS 1C A GALLON,
description: The Shell Oil Company anflounced yesterday a 1centagallon cut in the price of gasoline effective immediately, The, reduction applies to all classes Of trade, revellers and consumors. Shell said the reduction reflects current market conditions.

title: $16.1 Billion Deficit Seen For Transition Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, lan. 21A deficit of $16.1 billion expected in the Federal budget for the transition quarter, a onetime phenomenon that is being created by a shift the Government's fiscal year.

title: DR. HADDOW DIES; CANCER EXPERT, 69
description: AMERSHAM, England, Jan. 21 (AP)Sir Alexander Haddow, one of Britain's foremost cancer experts, died in a hospital near his home here today. He wag 69 years old.

title: An East Side Arcade
description: Would a socalled International Fair, a $2million arcade of boutiques, eating places and theaters built around a plaza save or ruin the congested neighborhood

title: Barbara Gibbons in a photo made April 1, 1973.
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Jan. 21 Barbara Gibbons nad $100 in cash in her possession the day she was murdered, the judge who was holding hearings here on a petition for a new trial for her son was told today.

title: DENTAL MATERIALS RECALLED BY F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration announced yesterday the recall of 1,600 jars of temporary dental fillings that it says are contaminated with poisonous lead and cadmium.

title: Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 President Ford's assault on crime, which he detailed at some length in the State of the Union Message, appeared in budget terms, according to some law enforcement officials, to be more rhetoric than reality.

title: Muskie Rebuttal Assails Ford on Jobs and Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Senator Edmund S. Muskie, charging that President Ford's economic plans were pennywise and poundfoolish, urged tonight a rejection of those who, he said, counsel go back and give up.

title: Dividends
LAURA RINFRET
description: Laura Chartrand Rinfrel, the widow of Alfred W. Rinfret, who was president of Rinfrel and Marchand Ltd., furriers, of Montreal, died Tuesday at Flushing (Queens) Hospital. She was 90 years old and lived at 14411 Sanford Avenue, Hushing.

title: STRIKING TEACHERS ACCEPT MONEY PLAN
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan 21 (AP)Striking public schoolteachers formally agreed today to the general terms of a $10 million salary proposal already accepted by the school board, but said the agreement did not mean an immediate end to their sevenweekold walkout.

title: LISBON POLICEMEN BATTLE STRIKERS
description: LISBON, Jan. 21A twohour strike by shopworkers today ended in an exchange of gunfire between the police and crowd in downtown Lisbon that left one dead and six wounded.

title: Guerrilla Leader Says Moves in Lebanon Strengthen Leftists Hand
description: DAMASCUS. Syria, Jan. 21Palestine Liberation Army troops are entering Lebanon and this has significantly strengthened the hand of Lebanese leftists and Palestinians in bargaining toward a lasting ceasefire there and toward a settlement enhancing their powers, P. Palestinilm guerrilla Iletider said today.

title: Felon Enters Political Race
description: CONCORD. Mass., Jan. 21 (AP)Carl Velleca, a Concord state prison inmate, has announced his candidacy for selectman here. He said that a State Supreme Court ruling permitting state prison inmates to vote by absentee ballot spurred his decision to run for one of two contested selectman positions. Mr. Velleca, 43 years old, is serving a 15to25 year sentence for armed robbery.

title: Federal Welfare Czar Is Under Study, Ford Says
