description: Campaign finance law in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and 32 other states will require drastic revision in the wake of yesterday's Supreme Court decision that struck down nearly all limits on campaign spending by candidates for Federal office.

title: Market Up 6.53 on Heaviest Trading Day
description: In record trading volume, prices on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday extended Thursday's gains in a broad advance. Stocks closed below their best levels of the day, however, on some late profit taking.

title: Braves and Sabres End Dates Dispute
description: BUFFALO N.Y.. Jan. 30 (UPI)Mayor Stanley Makowski said today that an agreement had been reached between the Buffalo Sabres of the National Hockey League and the Buffalo Braves of the National Basketball Association that would keep the Braves in Buffalo.

title: SLAIN NURSE'S BODY FOUND IN BROOKLYN
description: The police announced yesterday that a 26yearold nurse at the French Hospital was found shot to death in an abandoned building in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn Thursday night. She had been robbed and raped.

title: CITIBANK'S PRIME TRIMMED TO 6%
description: The First National City Bank of New York announced a quarterpoint reduction in its prime lending rate yesterday, to 6 percent from 6, pprrent, in a move that was expected to bring the, base lending rate of the banking system down to its lowest level in nearly three years.

title: UNIONS BID LISBON CURB TERRORISM
description: LISBON, Jan. 30A delegation of labor unions from the northern city of Braga today demanded urgent measures to end a wave of fascist terrorism that has struck northern Portugal.

title: ES. WON'T PURSUE SOVIET TRADE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger told a Senate committee today that because of Soviet military involvement in Angola the Ford Administration had dropped plans to ask Congress to consider lifting trade restrictions against the Soviet Union.

title: SUIT IN U.S. NAMES SWISS WATCH MAKERS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 (UPI) The Justice Department today charged Swiss producers of Omega and Tipsot watches and their United States distributors with conspiring to allocate markets and customers in this country in violation of antitrust law.

title: T.V.A. Gets Exemption From Labor Regulations
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30(AP) President Ford signed today an executive order that exempted the Tennessee Valley Authority from labormanagement regulations for the Federal service.

He is former publisher of The Los Angeles HeraldExpress, a predecessor of The HeraldExaminer. The publisher of The HeraldExaminer is George R. Hearst Jr.

title: ALBERT BLOCK
description: Albert Block, a former real estate developer of homes in the Five Towns area of Nassau County and the Heathcote area of Scarsdale, N. Y., died Monday at his home here. He was 88 years old.

title: Memorial Seruires
description: OTISAlice Wardwell, widow of the late Harold Otis of N. Y. C. and Soringfietd Centre, N. Y., deceased on Dec. 29, 1975. Memorial service Tuesday, Feb. 3, at 4 P.M., at Church of Epiphany, 74th st. and York Ave., N. Y. C. Omit flowers. TANEYEWSerge A. Memorial Service Sun. Feb. 1St at 12 Noon, 75 E. 93 St., N.Y.C.

title: Consumer Notes
description: A veterinarian has no right to refuse to treat an animal after having agreed to treat it, according to the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners.

title: Bridge:
description: The oldfashioned rubberbridge player feels that he has committed a major crime if the doubles the opponents into game. He tends to sneer at the duplicate player, who suffers this misfortune much more often, but overlooks the fact that his caution often allows the enemy to escape: they go down two, three or even four tricks undoubled when a moreaggressive opponent would have wielded the ax.

title: Upstate Power Lines Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 The Federal Power Commission, in a unanimous decision, authorized the Power Authority of the State of New York today to install a 36mile overhead transmission line in Schoharie and Green counties. The 345kilovolt line would deliver power from the BlenheimGilboa hydrolelectric project to Leeds. A second 345kilovolt line was also authorized.

title: An Optimistic View Of Agriculture's Future
description: THE LAST two years, a pessimistic outlook for the futufe of world agricultu're has arisen. This outlook has been fueled by constant repetition that evermoreserious food shortages are to occur because of exponential population growth, rising affluence, and lack of resources and technology. The facts, however, permit a more optimistic view.

title: F.B.I. Inquiry Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30The Justice Department has asked the Federal Bureau of Investigation to look into apparent violations of the Federal neutrality statutes by mercenary soldiers signing up to fight in Angola and by those who are recruiting them, sources in the department said today.

title: Tenants in Five Buildings Without Heat for a Month
description: About 60 tenants in five fivestory apartment buildings in the Little Italy section of Manhattan tomorrow will mark a full month of living without heat or hot water.

title: Robert Mehl, Metallurgist, CarnegieMellon Professor
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 30Dr. Robert Franklin Mehl, a former CarnegieMellon University professor and a leading metallurgist, died here yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: BAILEY SONGS SUNG IN MISS KING'S WAY
description: Teddi King sang a program of songs associated with Mildred Bailey at the Overseas Jazz Club in the Biltmore Hotel on Thursday, and the program did as much honor to the talent of Miss King, who is very much her own singer, as to the memory of Miss Bailey.

title: Rev. Francis W. Kearney, Let St. Bonaventure, 63
description: OLEAN, N.Y., Jan. 30 (AP) The Rev. Francis W. Kearney, a professor of philosophy who was president of St. Bonaventure University for almost six years in the 1960's, collapsed and died today. He was 63 years old.

title: Rabin Comment is Clarified After Accidental Omission
description: In a dispatch from Washington in The New York Times yesterday reporting on the visit of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel, the meaning of a paragraph was changed because of the accidental omission of several lines.

title: Export Rules Agreed On
description: BONN, West Germany, Jan. 30 (AP)The United States and six other nuclear powers have agreed on principles governing the export of nuclear power stations, the West German Foreign Ministry said today.

title: Hard Fight Shaping Up in Congress Over Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 30 Senators, Representatives and knowledgeable legislative aides predicted today that there would be a major battle in Congress over whether to reconstitute the Federal Election Commission.

title: Radio
Law Suit Disclosed By Marine Midland
description: A spokesman for Marine Midland Banks Inc. announced Nesterday that the concern had been advised that a lawsuit had been filed against the bank, its directors and its acOuntants. Price Waterhouse & Co., in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, alleging that the corporation's 1973 and 1974 annual reports were false and misleading in sev. ?oral particulars.

title: Oriole Farm Club Sold
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 30 (UPI) The Baltimore Orioles Miami club in the Class A Florida State League was sold today to a group headed by Joe Ryan, the president of the Class AAA American Association, Henry Peters, the Orioles vice president and general manager said the Miami team would continue with its working agreement as an Oriole farm club.

title: Southland Royalty Sets $160 Million Aztec Deal
description: The Southland Royalty Corporation said yesterday that it. would purchase at a cost of $160 million the 5 million shares of the Aztec Oil and Gas Company tendered in response to its offer earlier this month.

title: Lucarelli Pleases on Oboe
description: Bert Lucarelli is an oboist who likes to give concerts here, and since he is an expert player, New Yorkers are indebted to him. He presents programs that mix the traditional and not so traditional and are almost guaranteed to satisfy. His most recent venture into Alice Tully Hall, where he usually plays, was on Thursday night, and the works performed were of consistently high quality and interest.

title: Bruins Beat Flames on Doak Goal
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 30 (AP)Gary Doak's first goal of the season midway in the final period tonight snapped a tie and sent the Boston Bruins to a 42 National Hockey League triumph over the Atlanta Flames.

title: Dangerous Case of English
description: The newspapers are full of mystery this week. One has the sense of the reporters playing at Agatha Christie. Profusions of clues are scattered copiously through the newsprint, so copiously, in fact, that a cautious reader cannot help suspecting they are not clues at all, but distractions calculated to keep the public off the scent of the real news.
